characters: DROP THE GUN AND GET YOUR HANDS UP
TELL ME THE FUCKING CODE, SIMON.
PANNING THE EDGE OF THE FOUNTAIN
MY SONS ARE IN THAT SCHOOL MCCLANE.
WHERE THE FUCK IS A PHONE
DID ANY TRUCKS PULL INTO THE TUNNEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ' The sun is rising over the World Trade Towers. It’s a July morning; the city is already steaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detective’s bullpen is deserted. Shafts of sunlight pass through venetian blinds onto -- A CUP OF COFFEE on a desk, CAMERA picking up objects (photos, a detective’s shield) belonging to Detective John McClane, N.Y.P.D. Suddenly DOORS BANG OPEN. Cops and detectives enter for anew day, laughing, talking Yankees and Mets. INT. DETECTIVES’ BULLPEN - MORNING - LATER The room is packed with UNIFORMED COPS and DETECTIVES. Incessant CHATTER and TAPPING WORD PROCESSORS. IN THE CORNER - A GROUP OF N.Y.P.D. DETECTIVES are going over case files, drinking coffee. RICKY WALSH sits with his feet propped on his desk, looking at a CLIPBOARD.

dialogues.speaker: WALSH
dialogues.text: I got an eyewitness on a two-eleven in Bed Stuy. Hispanic male, mid- 20’s with a red windbreaker.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE 2
dialogues.text: I’ll take it, Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: WALSH
dialogues.text: (makes notation on clipboard) Sold to the man in the seersucker suit. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N.Y.P.D. Chief of Detectives ARTHUR COBB is talking to DETECTIVE JOE LAMBERT.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Overreacting? Really? Larry down at O’Neil’s says he closes the place every night.

dialogues.speaker: LAMBERT
dialogues.text: He doesn’t have a drinking problen.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: I’m not saying he does. But he won’t take a physical. He told the shrink downtown to - I’m putting this in her words - have intercourse with herself. What’s eating him? Man’s inhumanity to Man? The plight of Tibet? The Mets’ outfield?

dialogues.speaker: LAMBERT
dialogues.text: Arthur, John’s not had the best year...

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: I don’t want a testimonial. His caseload’s down. There’s talk of a leave of absence. I’ve got to see some change. You and Ricky have known him since kindergarten - you talk to him. They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long functional john with a thousand toilets and sinks. TWO UNIFORMED ROOKIE COPS are taking a piss, whispering. In the b.g., we hear a ROARING FAUCET.

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE COP 1
dialogues.text: You ever seen him?

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE COP 2
dialogues.text: Yeah. Couple times at the range.

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE COP 1
dialogues.text: What’s he look like? One of the guys downtown told me he sleeps here half the time.  MCCLANE (0.s.) Only a quarter of the time, fellahs. The cops, startled, look over at -- JOHN MCCLANE, at the sink, spitting out toothpaste. McClane is 40 now. His hair is flecked with grey. He stands upright and turns off the faucet. Wipes his mouth on his sleeve. McClane walks past the rookie cops with his toothbrush and toothpaste.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Good views, bad room service. McClane walks out the door past the stunned cops and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s 9:00 a.m. and already humid as a locker room. On 3rd Avenue, SHOPPERS crowd through the doors of BLOOMINGDALES eager to take advantage of a cosmetics and lingerie sale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LADIES walk the aisles, exchanging cool smiles with swishy PERFUME SALESMEN who display their scents. AT THE COUNTER - A LADY SHOPPER applies eye shadow. She bends forward, looking in a small mirror on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SHOPPER
dialogues.text: Hmm. This one’s nice. The SALESGIRL, on the other side of the counter, agrees.

dialogues.speaker: SALESGIRL
dialogues.text: Yes, I like that one. The LADY SHOPPER bends closer to the mirror. Her shoe hits something. She looks down. A SAMSONITE BRIEFCASE sits at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: LADY SHOPPER
dialogues.text: Oh dear, someone left their briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: SALESGIRL
dialogues.text: (smiles) Happens all the time. 1/11 take it. The Lady Shopper picks up the briefcase and hands it  across the counter to the Salesgirl. The Salesgirl examines the briefcase. It is TICKING.

dialogues.speaker: SALESGIRL
dialogues.text: Do you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: LADY SHOPPER
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes I do. They each look at the briefcase. They look at each other. A huge blast. An eruption of flame. The place blows to pieces. Flying glass and metal. The jewelry counters become airborne. It is over suddenly. CEILING SPRINKLERS douse the carnage. Corpses lie amidst the wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh and the detectives continue their morning routine.

dialogues.speaker: WALSH
dialogues.text: I got a theft of ten industrial dumptrucks on Staten Island.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Insurance fraud. Everyone turns to McClane; he’s at his desk, knotting his necktie, lighting another cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: By now the trucks are in California and the contractor’s collecting theft insurance which. he’1l split with the thieves. They’ve run that scam in Jersey for years. I’1ll take it, Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: WALSH
dialogues.text: (makes notation) Sold to the man who bathes with "High Karate."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Spice.

dialogues.speaker: . WALSH
dialogues.text: I did detect a fresher bouquet. JOE LAMBERT walks up humming the theme from "Jeopardy."
He has DOLLAR BILLS in one hand and A CUP OF COFFEE in the other. He shoves the coffee in McClane’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: LAMBERT
dialogues.text: Category: New York Trivia. Detective Walsh, this mediocre center fielder replaced the legendary Joe Dimaggio.

dialogues.speaker: WALSH
dialogues.text: Who is...Carl Bennet.

dialogues.speaker: LAMBERT
dialogues.text: ONK. Lou Boudreaux. (pockets. the $5 bill) Detective McClane, for ten dollars, this is the biggest engineering job in the U.S. since the Hoover Dam.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: No idea, Alex.

dialogues.speaker: LAMBERT
dialogues.text: What is the New York City Aquaduct from the Catskill Mountains to the Isle of Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: WALSH
dialogues.text: They ever going to finish that thing? Suddenly the bullpen’s EMERGENCY BELL CLANGS. Everyone whips their neck around.

dialogues.speaker: WALSH
dialogues.text: Ahh fuck... During this, Lambert turns to McClane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let’s talk later, okay?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: LAMBERT
dialogues.text: Life. Yours in particular. McClane and Lambert lock eyes. A UNIFORMED COP enters the bullpen, shouting:

dialogues.speaker: UNIFORMED COP
dialogues.text: Somebody just blew up Bloomingdales! Everyone stares at each other.

dialogues.speaker: WALSH
dialogues.text: Bloomingdales? What the fuck’s anybody got against Bloomingdales?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever see a woman miss a shoe sale? McClane and the Detectives scramble around, throwing on their suit jackets, checking their weapons, etc.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE HALL
dialogues.text: leans out his office, shouting instructions to McClane, Lambert, Walsh, and the others who are rushing. through the bullpen.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF COBB
dialogues.text: McClane, compile a witness sheet. Ricky, seal off a five block radius; Joe, keep the T.V. crews the hell out of there! The detectives roar out through double doors. Cobb’s secretary, JANE, calls from inside the office. SECRETARY JANE (0.s) Arthur! Phone!

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Not now. JANE appears next to him. Her face is ash white.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY JANE
dialogues.text: Arthur, you'd better take this. (Cobb looks at her) He says he set the bomb at Bloomingdales. They stare at each other. Cobb turns, looks into his office at -- COBB’S DESK ~ HIS TELEPHONE - It is flashing. Cobb goes into his office and picks up the phone. He punches a line button. It connects a call.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Hello? We hear a voice. A European accent. It is, from the first syllable, chilling and unforgettable. It is Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simple Simon met a pie man Going to the fair. Said Simple Simon to the pie-man: Give me your pies or I’1ll cave your fucking head in.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF COBB
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Simon. Hello, Arthur. (beat) Bloomingdales was just for show. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF COBB
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I want to play a game.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF COBB
dialogues.text: What kind of game?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Simon Says. (beat) Is John McClane there? A pause. Cobb stares at the phone receiver.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF COBB
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Good. . (suddenly low, sinister) Listen to me, Arthur. In the next several hours Simon is going to tell Detective McClane what to do and Detective McClane is going to do it. If he fails to comply with the slightest detail of my instructions, there will be a penalty.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: What penalty?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Ten pounds of plastique explosive will be detonated in a crowded public place. Cobb swallows. His throat is suddenly dry.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Just a second. (covers the receiver; yells to his secretary) Janie! Get MeClane! COBB’S SECRETARY (appearing in the doorway) He just went to Blooming....

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Get him. Run! Jane runs off. Cobb takes his hand off the receiver:

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: What do you want Detective McClane to do?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Simon Says Detective McClane is to stand on the corner of 138th street and Amsterdam, which is in Harlen, if I’m not mistaken....

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A STREET SIGN: "AMSTERDAM AVE", crossed at a right angle with "138TH ST." MOVING UP AND PANNING around --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On each corner of this intersection is a business: A bodega, a bar, a laundromat, and an APPLIANCE SHOP.

dialogues.speaker: ON 138TH ST.
dialogues.text: all 20’s and late teens, are hanging out on the bar’s delivery bulkhead in their bathrobes, laughing, smoking cigarettes and drinking beers. They are watching -- The two BIGGEST GANGMEMBERS (GANGMEMBERS 1 & 2) playing black-jack on an overturned milk carton. It’s high- stakes. The carton is covered with cards and money.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: come down Amsterdam. They are DEXTER 12, and RAYMOND, 10. Dexter is lugging a big STEREO RECEIVER. The kids walk toward the appliance shop on the corner.  10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is jammed with refrigerators, washing machines, stereos, T.V.s, etc. DING! a bell on the door sounds as the kids enter.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Uncle! ZEUS CARVER, 29, black, comes through the maze of junk. He has confidence, a strong sense of himself. He looks people in the eye. He doesn’t like weakness or indifference. He’s a man with things on his mind. He is often angry, due to attitudes and conditions which have prevailed in this country for the last 300 years. Zeus walks up to the boys. He’s known them since they were born; they’re his nephews.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: It’s 9:15. Why aren’t you at school?

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Tony wants to sell you this.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: And it was such a good deal you had to cut school. Un-huh. And it was so heavy you both had to carry it. Un-huh. Give it here. Dexter hands Zeus the stereo receiver. He examines it. ZEUS . Where’s the serial number plate? Where’d Tony get this?

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: Says he found it.

dialogues.speaker: _ DEXTER
dialogues.text: It ain‘’t hot. Zeus opens the cash register and pulls out two twenties and a ten. He hands the bills to the kids.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: There’s fifty dollars. If he tries to chisel you for more, tell him no deal. and I’1ll return the stereo tomorrow - and don’t spend the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ii. Dexter reaches for the bills. Zeus retracts then. Now a series of questions. Sort of a routine...

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Then what’re you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: Go to school.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: To get educated.

dialogues.speaker: " ZEUS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: So we can go to college.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Why’s that important?

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: To get respect.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Who’s the bad guys?

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Guys who sell drugs.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Who else?

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Guys who have guns.

dialogues.speaker: . ZEUS
dialogues.text: Who’s the good guys?

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: We’re the good guys.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Who’s gonna help you?

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: So who’s gonna help you?

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: We’re gonna help ourselves.  12.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: And who do we not want to help us?

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: White people. ~

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: That’s right. Satisfied, Zeus offers the bills again. Dexter snags them. They smile at Zeus and tear out the door. Zeus carries the stereo to the work bench, muttering:

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Ain’t hot. Thing’s so hot you could fry an egg on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A block away, a POLICE VAN rolls up. Stops at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back compartment, John McClane sits with Chief of Detectives Cobb. McClane wears nothing but a terry- cloth bathrobe, socks and shoes. ‘The VAN DRIVER leans into the back compartment.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: This is it, Captain. Cobb turns to McClane.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Where’s the gun? McClane swivels around and lowers his robe. Taped to his bare back is a SMALL CALIBER PISTOL. McClane swivels back around. Cobb looks at him. frowns.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: You look like shit.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do, Arthur, comb my fuckin’ hair? (beat) If you want to talk to me, talk to me. Don’t send Ricky. What’s this all about?

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: I’m going to recommend retirement.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I won’t fight. it. They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: We'll talk about it later. Listen: We’re pulling back to 125th. (off McClane’s reaction) Simon said no cops within a ten . block radius or we get another bomb. . There are fifty rooftops up here that would give him a view. You want to take the chance he’s not watching?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: (shakes his head; a pause) . What the hell is this all about?

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: I have no idea, John. McClane takes a deep breath and opens the van door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane gets out of the van in his bathrobe. Cobb hands McClane a LARGE WHITE SANDWICH BOARD from the van. (The kind worn by street advertisers: two pieces of plywood connected with twine.) McClane slips off his bathrobe and tosses it to Cobb. He’s now in boxer shorts, socks, and dress shoes.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: (to the driver) Go. (turns back to McClane) Fifteen minutes. McClane nods. The police van pulls away from the curb, does a U-turn, and heads south on Amsterdan. McClane watches the van go. He turns and looks at the run-down surroundings. He puts on the sandwich board. We are behind him. We can’t see the front of the board.  14. McClane heads north on the sidewalk, heading toward 138th street, one block away. FOLLOWING MCCLANE - as he walks. UP AHEAD - A BLACK WOMAN, 50’sS, comes out of a decrepid brownstone and walks down the front stoop. She turns south on the sidewalk, heading for McClane. McClane and the Black Woman Pass each other. McClane walks past her and keeps walking. THE BLACK WOMAN stops, wide-eyed, double-taking. She looks over her shoulder at McClane.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: What in heaven's name...? McClane continues to the corner of 138th and Amsterdam. There, he stops. CLOSE ON McClane - Sweat beads on his brow. His eyes dart in all directions. MCCLANE’S POV - PANNING AROUND THE INTERSECTION No traffic. Quiet sidewalks. McClane’s eyes PAN from the bodega, to the liquor store, to the laundromat, to ZEUS CARVER’S APPLIANCE SHOP. His eyes lock on - THE GANGMEMBERS playing cards down 138th street. They are wrapped up in the game. They do not see hin.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: wipes the sweat from his forehead. Under his breath:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Shit. . Across the street, outside Zeus’s appliance shop, DEXTER and RAYMOND are staring at him. Dexter whispers to Raymond. They go back into the appliance shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An electric stove is jacked up on cinder blocks. Zeus is under it. We only see his legs. The front door bell DINGS. unele! DEXTER (0.s.) Inclie:  15.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: What are you doing back here? I’m busy. RAYMOND (0.s.) You better look at this! Zeus, muttering under his breath, slides out from under the stove, a red-hot SOLDER GUN in hand. He looks up at Dexter and Raymond.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: There’s a white man out there.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: You take me from my work to see a white man? I’ve seen plenty.

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: Not like this. They point to the window. : Zeus walks to the window and separates the grimy venetian blinds with his fingers. He looks out. He blinks. He looks again, squinting. He comes away from the window. Says to Dexter:

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Get on the phone. Dial nine-one- one. Tell ‘em you want a police car up here real fast or somebody's gonna die. Dexter and Raymond stare at Zeus.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Go! Dexter and Raymond run toward the back of the shop. Zeus goes to the door. Exits the shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeus comes out of his shop, the solder iron still in hand. He looks around the intersection. Across the street, the GANG MEMBERS are hanging out, playing cards, oblivious to anything unusual. Zeus looks south-easterly, at the other corner. It is a bizarre, surreal sight.

In blazing sunshine, on the worst street in Harlem, a white man is standing in boxer shorts, socks, and shoes, wearing a large white sandwich board. It is McClane. The front of the board,” in huge red letters, reads:

dialogues.speaker: I HATE NIGGERS
dialogues.text: Zeus blinks. He frowns. He thinks. He walks diagonally across the intersection. MCCLANE sees Zeus coming. Zeus approaches him. He stops in the street ten feet from McClane, eyeing him quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Good morning. They stare at each other. Zeus’ eyes dart from McClane to the GANG MEMBERS on the corner.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Havin’ a good day, sir? You feelin’ okay? (comes closer) ' Not to get too personal, but a white man standing in the middle of Harlem wearing a sign saying "I hate Niggers" has either got some personal issues or he’s a few boats shy of a fleet. (comes closer, voice lowering) I’m talkin’ to you, man: you’ve got ten seconds, maybe less, before those guys see you. If they see you, they’1l1 kill you. Do you understand me?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I’m a cop.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I can’t explain now. Out of the corner of his eye, Zeus sees --

dialogues.speaker: THE CARDGAME
dialogues.text: having lost a big hand, flings his cards over his opponent's head. The cards twirl like little frisbees TOWARD THE INTERSECTION CORNER.  17. The opponent (GANG MEMBER 2). chases the cards. He grabs a couple. He is nearly in the intersection. Suddenly he freezes -- He stands up, looking straight at McClane. The other GANG MEMBERS, following the flight of the cards, also see him.

dialogues.speaker: GANG MEMBER 2
dialogues.text: What the fuck....?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Ahh shittt..... THE GANG MEMBERS are now standing on the opposite corner of the street, staring at McClane and Zeus. MCCLANE turns to Zeus, his speech clipped, urgent:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Listen: an hour ago somebody bombed Bloomingdales.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, I heard it on the news.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Whoever did that said I had to do this or he’d blow up something else.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: (incredulous) What? Whether Zeus believes McClane or not, it’s too late now. THE GANG MEMBERS start across the street.

dialogues.speaker: . MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I have a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? Never mind. You pull a gun, they’1ll kill you. Listen: you’re obviously not crazy, but I want you to act it. Like Looney Toons, okay? McClane nods, acknowledging this. The GANG MEMBERS are upon them. They circle around McClane, staring at the sandwich board. They are amused. Sort of. They smile. After an ice-cold pause:

dialogues.speaker: GANG MEMBER 1
dialogues.text: Hey Zeus. This a friend o’ yours? (to McClane) Huh? You a friend o’ his? McClane looks Gang Member 1 straight in the eye, his demeanor suddenly changing. McClane’s eyes have become those of a lunatic.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: My only friend is God. The Gang Members look at each other. Some LAUGH. Gang Member 1 comes up close to McClane. Looks: at McClane’s sandwich board.

dialogues.speaker: GANG MEMBER 1
dialogues.text: God, huh? Does your god hate niggers too? (pulls a switchblade from his pocket) He better, deuce. You’re gonna need hin. : (over shoulder, to other Gang Members) Let’s fuck this guy up.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: The guy’s crazy. Look at hin. Standing out here in his underwear. He doesn’t know what he’s doing. He probably doesn’t know where he is. Some mental ward escapee.... Gang Member 2 steps forward. Stares at McClane. Then he turns to Zeus. .

dialogues.speaker: GANG MEMBER 2
dialogues.text: So he’s crazy. So are we. The other Gang Members LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: GANG MEMEBER 1
dialogues.text: (to. Zeus) Back off. Zeus stays put. Doesn’t budge. The Gang Members crowd in around McClane. Gang Member 1, brandishing the knife under McClane’s nose, motions to the sandwich board.

dialogues.speaker: GANG MEMBER 1
dialogues.text: Get that off hin. TWO GANGMEMBERS lift the back face of the sandwich

board, roughly, over McClane’s shoulders, and fling it to the ground. The boards CLATTER on the ground. McClane staggers forward, his torso now exposed. Taped to the small of his back is the .22 clip handgun. Zeus sees the gun before anyone else. He lunges behind McClane and RIPS the gun from McClane’s back, tape and all. zeus brings the gun down, training it on the Gang Members, wildly, back and forth, from member to member. Startled, they recoil. Except for Gang Member 1, who sticks the switchblade under McClane’s chin. :

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Put it down. A tense pause. Zeus cocks the gun. His hand is rock steady. ZEUS . I’1l kill you. I won’t want to, but I’1l do it. Gang Member 1 tosses the knife down. He backs off. McClane joins Zeus. At this moment -- A HARLEM LIVERY CAB comes up to the intersection and stops at the light. It’s right next to them. Zeus points a gun at THE LIVERY CAB DRIVER, who looks back with wide, terrified eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Stay where you are. Zeus motions to McClane. McClane moves to the cab, Zeus following, stepping backward, the gun trained on the Gang Members. They get in the cab. It roars off down Amsterdan, leaving -- The Gang Members running after the car, SHOUTING OBSCENITIES, throwing beer bottles, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane and Zeus sit in the back seat. Up front, the LIVERY DRIVER, is quaking in his seat. He thrusts money into the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: LIVERY DRIVER
dialogues.text: Don’t kill me! That’s all I got! Zeus rolls his eyes. Hands the money back to hin.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Ahh man, I ain’t robbin’ you. Just get us outta here. Head downtown. Run the lights.

dialogues.speaker: LIVERY DRIVER
dialogues.text: You got it boss! The car lurches forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are the P.O.V. of someone sitting in a parked car at 139TH AND AMSTERDAM, one block north. We have just seen the foregoing incident. We lower . BINOCULARS from our eyes, hand them to someone in the passenger seat, and engage the gears. We pull away from the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is rocketing down Amsterdan. Zeus turns to McClane. Hands him the gun.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: I just had my day fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Join the club.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: So one more time: The guy who bombed Bloomingdales wanted you to wear a sign in Harlem saying "I hate niggers."

dialogues.speaker: . MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Yep. (pronouncing it latino: “hey-zoos") Jesus, right? (extends his hand) I owe you one. You’ll be compensated for any loss of livelihood.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Well get your checkbook out ‘cause that was my appliance shop on the corner. You have any idea what those guys are doing to it right now? .

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Chill, out, Jesus. I/11 have a car sent up.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Chill out? Speak like a white person. (beat) And where do you get off callin’ me Jesus? Do I look Puerta Rican?

dialogues.speaker: MCLANE
dialogues.text: (confused) The guy back there. He called you Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: He didn’t say "hey-zoos." He said, “Hey. Zeus." My name is Zeus.

dialogues.speaker: MCLANE
dialogues.text: Zeus.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Yes. Father of Apollo? Nice pad on Mount Olympus? Don’t-fuck-with-me- or-I’11-shove-a-lightning-bolt-up- your-ass? Zeus, man, the Roman god. You got a problem with it? McClane looks Zeus over. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: You’re a helluva date, Zeus. Let’s do this every Tuesday, deal? McClane notices -- THE LIVERY CAB DRIVER is making strange eyes at McClane and Zeus in the rear-view mirror. (remember, McClane is almost entirely nude).

dialogues.speaker: LIVERY DRIVER
dialogues.text: Hey - where we goin’?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Fifty-fifth and second.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Police precinct.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVERY CAB
dialogues.text: ROARS through the interSection at BROADWAY AND 80TH. Zeus (v.0.) Pull this goddamn cab over right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops and detectives come and go on the stone staircase of the largest police precinct in the world. The livery cab pulls up. McClane gets out. He pulls his wallet out of his sock (he’s still in his underwear) and pays the Driver.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Come on. zeus stays seated in the cab.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: I’m not going in there. There’s folks in there I generally try to avoid.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: You can give a statement now or you can give a statement later. (Zeus doesn’t move) I‘d make up your mind. I’m not going to stand out here like this all day. . Zeus frowns. He gets out of the cab. He follows McClane up the stairs into the precinct. TWO UNIFORMED cops exit and come down the stairs. They pass McClane and Zeus, stopping, doubletaking.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: This loss of livelihood compensation: how much money we talking about? They go inside the building.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CHIEF OF DETECTIVE COBB’S OFFICE - DAY Cobb is behind his desk, on the phone. The phone is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hooked up to a TELEPHONE CALL TRACING MACHINE. Lambert sits in front of the desk, flipping through a large stack of FILES. McClane’s putting his clothes back on. Cobb hangs up the phone. Turns to McClane.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: You getting anywhere?

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: C'mon, John. Think. MCCLANE . It’s not somebody I busted, Arthur ” COBB How can you be sure of that?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: "Simon." It’s not an ordinary name. I’d remember it. We’re up the wrong tree anyway. He’s not going to use his real name.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN CORNER
dialogues.text: I disagree, Lieutenant. McClane turns. In the corner is a MAN, 40’s, smoking a pipe.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Fred Schilling, John. Fred does a lot of our psychiatric criminal evaluations at Bellevue hospital.- I asked him to be here. What’s your opinion, Doctor? A pause. Schilling puffs his pipe.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SCHILLING
dialogues.text: Any understanding of this character starts, necessarily, with an understanding of megalomania - it’s a sickness - a pathological condition in which fantasies of control, or omnipotence, predominate.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Speak English.  24.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SCHILLING
dialogues.text: He wants control over you - every move you make, your thoughts, your emotions. Megalomaniacs don’t operate anonymously - they need to know that you’ know who they are. (beat; he puffs on his pipe) I can virtually guarantee this man’s name is Simon - or possibly some variation of that.

dialogues.speaker: LAMBERT
dialogues.text: Doesn’t have to be his first name. (looks at file) I’ve got a Robert E. Simon right here. You busted him in, let’s see...Nineteen...

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Eighty-six. Extortion and kidnapping. He’s up in Ossining. LAMBERT . No he’s not. He got ten to fifteen and served seven for good behavior. He was released to the state work- furlough program two months ago.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Check it out, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: You’re wasting your time. Bob Simon was a bankrupt businessman who kidnapped his former partner’s daughter. He’s a fuck-up, not a Psychopath. The guy we’re dealing with is nuts. WEISS (0.s.) A nut who knows a lot about bombs. CHARLES WEISS, head of N.Y.P.D.’s Incendiary Control and Forensics Team, or I.C.F.T. (i.e., the "Bomb Squad") enters the office, carrying a SAMSONITE BRIEFCASE. Weiss is a frenetic, serious little guy who likes his job a little too much.

dialogues.speaker: WEISS
dialogues.text: We found this under a bench in Central Park and I must say, as a professional, this is very cool stuff. Weiss sets the briefcase on the desk. Attached to the briefcase is a SMALL BOX with a protruding ANTENNAE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten pounds of plastique, just like he said. The detonation system's not a fuse, not a timer. It’s that. (points at the box) Radio transmittor. Super high, super delicate frequency. Now watch. He pops open the briefcase. A HUGE PACKAGE OF PLASTIQUE EXPLOSIVE and a BLASTING CAP is within. Wires run from the transmittor to the blasting cap. Lambert, seeing the explosive, recoils.

dialogues.speaker: LAMBERT
dialogues.text: Christ, Charlie!

dialogues.speaker: WEISS
dialogues.text: Take it easy. It’s disarmed. The beauty of this system is that it can be detonated from anywhere up to ten, twenty miles away. (he looks up at the others) Your boy’s no amateur, Arthur. This is the most sophisticated system in the world. Army stuff. SEAL team stuff. Most terrorists don’t have this stuff...

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Charlie...? We get the message. Thanks. Weiss picks up the briefcase, goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: WIESS
dialogues.text: This is gonna be an interesting one, fellahs. Weiss exits.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Joe, start with the military. Special Forces and Navy Seals. Any discharge less than honorable, any psycho case.

dialogues.speaker: LAMBERT
dialogues.text: You got it. (points out window into the bullpen) What about him? Cobb and McClane look through the window at --  26. IN THE BULLPEN - Zeus CARVER sits with DETECTIVE WALSH at WALSH’S desk. Walsh is typing. Zeus is giving Walsh his statement.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Take his statement and let him go. Suddenly Cobb’s phone BUZZES. COBB’S Secretary pops her head in the office.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Arthur. It’s him. Everyone exchanges a glance.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Here we go again, fellahs. Cobb goes to the phone and turns on the TRACING MACHINE. McClane, Lambert, and Schilling gather around the desk. Cobb hits a button, connecting the SPEAKER PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Simon? After a lengthy pause:

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I’m hurt. Really. I’m not very happy. He wore the board and stood on the corner. Congratulations. Marvelous. Where are my pigeons? (cheery) I had two pigeons bright and gay, They flew from me the other day. What was the reason they did go? You cannot tell; for you do not know.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: You mean McClane?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: No, I mean Santa Clause. Cobb, McClane, and Lambert exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: He‘s here.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: What about the....dark one.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: He’s in the other....

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Get hin. Cobb motions to Lambert. Lambert goes to the door and leans out, motioning frantically to WALSH AND Zeus. Meanwhile, Simon continues:

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: About the trace you’re putting on this call: it will take ten minutes, and five more for a car to get here, which happens to be a public payphone, so why don’t we put that idea to beddy-bye? Walsh and Zeus enter the office.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: All present? zeus looks at the phone. Looks at everyone else.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Who’s that?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Hello. I took great trouble to prepare that game for Mr. McClane and look what you did to my well- laid plans.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: (to the room) This the Bloomingdales guy? (Cobb nods) As far as I’m concerned, you can stick your well-laid plans up your well-laid.... . CLICK. Cobb turns to Zeus,. furious.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Christ, there are people’s lives at stake. (beat) You’d better hope he calls back. A dreadful silence falls on the room. Everyone stares at the phone. The phone RINGS. Cobb springs for it. Punches the button. The call connects.  CLICK. 28.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Simon? Please. Simon? He spoke out of turn.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (after a pause) That was unpleasant. Don’t let it happen again? : (low, sinister) What’s your name, boy?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Zeus Carver. Don’t call me boy.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I’1l call you tarbaby if I like. I was going to spare you; now I’ve changed my mind. (pause) Simon Says: McClane and Zeus take a cab to the subway station at 72nd and Broadway. I will call you both in fifteen minutes at the payphone in the island. Any police escort or . failure to answer my call will cause non-compliance. By now you’ve found my briefcase - you understand the severity of the penalty.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: You can make it if you go right now. Somebody get out front and hail ‘em a cab. Walsh hustles out of the office. 2Eus Whoah whoah whoah. Everyone looks at Zeus.

dialogues.speaker: . ZEUS
dialogues.text: I ain’t going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: He said you have to.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: I don’t care what he said. I’m not jumping through no hoops for some psycho. This is a white man with white problems, fellahs. (walks to the door) I was a fool to get messed up in this in the first place. Have fun.  29. Zeus is almost out the door. McClane’s voice stops him:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: He’s going to ‘kill a lot more people. Zeus turns. Levels cold eyes at McClane:

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: I hope they’re white. And he continues out the door. Cobb turns to McClane:

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: . Get him back here, John.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Where was the bomb in the Park? High or low?

dialogues.speaker: WALSH
dialogues.text: High. The jungle gym at 107th. McClane hurries out the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and runs after Zeus, who is walking quickly toward the exit. He heads him off. Zeus stops.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: You know the playground at 107th Street?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: of course I know it, it’s in Harlem. I played there when I was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: That’s where we found the last bomb. (beat) This isn’t a "white" problen, zeus. Zeus frowns. He wearily turns and follows McClane back to Cobb’s office and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane and Zeus are exiting Cobb’s office and Cobb is barking orders:  30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, don’t play around - do exactly what he says. Ricky and Joe - get a civilian vehicle from the undercover guys. Follow ‘em to 72nd, but keep your distance’ - and keep me informed! McClane and Zeus disappear through the exit doors. Lambert and Walsh go the other way to the motor pool. Cobb goes back in his office. Mumbles:

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Simon Says. Shit. (hits the intercom on his phone) Janie, get me the Mayor’s office. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YELLOW TAXI CAB sits at the curb. A UNIFORMED PATROLMAN holds the door open for -- McClane and Zeus who race down the stone steps. They hop in the taxi; the door is slammed shut; the taxi speeds off into traffic. cUuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi pulls up to the curb on Broadway. McClane and Zeus scramble out and run across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station entrance is on an island in the the middle of the intersection, directly above the train track. Next to the station is a NEWS KIOSK. Next to the kiosk is a PAYPHONE. McClane and Zeus run up to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sits at the curb. Detectives Walsh and Lambert in it. Walsh speaks into a c.b. RADIO

dialogues.speaker: WALSH
dialogues.text: They're at the payphone now, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN, 30’s, well-dressed, is talking as McClane and
Zeus approach.

dialogues.speaker: UPPER WEST SIDE WOMAN
dialogues.text: Clair, You should see the sale at Zabars.... .

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Maam? (she ignores him) Maam, we need to use.... Zeus reaches into the cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Get the fuck off the phone, lady. (he disconnects the call) This is police business.

dialogues.speaker: UPPER WEST SIDE WOMAN
dialogues.text: Hey! Horrified, she grabs her bags and moves off.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: There’s another phone across the street, maan. McClane turns to Zeus.

dialogues.speaker: . MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Let’s get something straight: I’m on police business. You’re not.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Let’s get something straight: you need me more than I need you.. If you don’t like the way I do things, fine. (walks away from the phone) I quit. And the phone RINGS! Zeus stops, turns, eyeing the ringing phone. McClane and Zeus lock eyes, glaring at each other.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: He said you have to be here. (Zeus doesn’t move) All right. I need you. (Zeus doesn’t move; McClane sighs) All right, I need you more than you need me.
zeus reluctantly goes back to the phone. McClane answers the phone. zeus crowds in next to McClane, sharing the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: " MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Hello. .

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Birds of a feather flock together, And so will pigs and swine. Rats and mice all had their chance, And so will I have mine. (beat) Why was the phone busy? Were you calling someone?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I think there’s been non-compliance. I think people are going to die.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: No. It was just some lady. I swear it. Just some lady.

dialogues.speaker: C SIMON
dialogues.text: I believe you, John. Oh, my! It’s time for a pop mental aptitude quiz. Simon laughs. McClane and Zeus exchange a glance: "What the fuck..?"

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (now low and very fast) Solve the following riddle or you get a penalty. Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! What’s the penalty?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Oh. The trash receptacle next to you? McClane and Zeus look at the WIRE TRASH CAN next to them which has been IN FRAME the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: There’s ten pounds of plastique in it. Listen carefully: (then, very fast) As I was going to St. Ives I met a man with seven wives  33. SIMON (cont‘’d) Every wife had seven sacks, Every sack had seven cats, Every cat had seven kittens. Kittens, cats, sacks and wives, How many weré going to St. Ives? (beat) My phone number is 555 and the answer. Call me in thirty seconds or die. CLICK. McClane stares at Zeus.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: What was it, seven wives at St. Ives?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Shut up. I’m good at this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: There were seven wives with seven sacks, right?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: SHUT THE FUCK UP, McClane. McClane shuts up. Zeus’s mind is going overdrive.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Seven wives with seven sacks is forty-nine sacks. What was the rest?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Something about cats and kittens.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Right. Each sack has seven cats. That’s forty-nine sacks with seven cats each which is three hundred forty-two cats. Each cat-’has seven kittens so it’s three hundred forty- two cats with seven kittens each which is...two thousand four hundred and. one kittens. Easy. Dial 555- 2401.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: He said "kittens, cats, sacks and wives."

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Shit, you’re Fight. So it’s let’s see...seven wives, forty-nine sacks, three hundred and forty-two cats and two thousand.... (does the addition) Two thousand, eight hundred!

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: (punching the numbers, looking at his watch) - We're not going to make it.... The call connects.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: You‘re date. I’m very sorry. McClane grabs Zeus and dives away from the phone booth, screaming to SURROUNDING PEDESTRIANS:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: THERE’S A BOMB IN THE TRASHCAN! McClane and Zeus land in a heap on the pavement, covering up. Seconds pass. Nothing happens. McClane sloowwly looks up. A BUNCH OF NEW YORKERS are staring at them. The PHONE RECEIVER is swinging by its cord, and emanating from it WE HEAR SIMON LAUGHING. McClane and Zeus get up and go back to the phonebooth. McClane lifts the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I didn’t say "Simon Says." McClane and Zeus collapse against the walls of the payphone compartment, breathing hard. 2Eus This guy’s getting on my nerves.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Look through the grate next to the phone, John. McClane looks down at a big VENTILATION GRATE next to  35. the payphone. Twenty feet down, through the GRATE, he can see PEOPLE on the platform, waiting for the train.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: It is exactly 4:50. Has the number 5 train arrived? Suddenly the metal ventilation grate VIBRATES. We hear the DULL RUMBLE of a train pulling in.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: It’s pulling in now.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: This morning I left something provocative on it. Explosive even. (suddenly low, dark, and very fast) Simon Says get to the payphone at the south end of the Wall Street station next to the news kiosk by 5:20 or the number 5 train, and all its passengers, will cease to exist. If you use any means of travel other than a civilian vehicle, I will blow the train. If you make any attempt to close or evacuate the subway system, I will blow the train. I will call you in thirty minutes. You'd better be there. Toodle-ooh.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Simon, wait. Wait.... CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane hangs up. He looks around, panicking.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: What’s he want?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: We've got to be at Wall Street in half an hour.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Or what?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: He’11] detonate a bomb on that train. McClane and Zeus look down. BELOW them, PASSENGERS are stepping onto THE FIVE TRAIN. The doors SLAM shut. The train pulls away from the subway platform.  36. zeus Where are we, low 70's? Here to Wall Street in thirty minutes?

dialogues.speaker: " MCCLANE
dialogues.text: It’s possible.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: At four a.m. Look around: it’s morning rush hour. iIt’ll take at least forty minutes. We don’t even have a car.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Think positively.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: I’m thinking positively and WE STILL DON’T HAVE A CAR.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: That’s a temporary.... (looks around) ++.set-back. McClane dashes off the island into the street, FLAGGING A CAB. The cab pulls over. McClane flashes his N.Y.P.D. SHIELD at the DRIVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m requistitioning this vehicle for police business, sir. The driver, an ARAB, looks aghast at McClane.

dialogues.speaker: ARAB CABBIE
dialogues.text: No Englie, no Englie.... McClane yanks open the door. The Arab driver reluctantly gets out. McClane gets in, Zeus in the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They settle in. McClane grips the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Pretty slick. Show a badge, get a car. What do you think, Ninth Avenue?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: (thinking) No.  37. zEuUS I used to drive a cab. I know the best routes. Ninth Avenue... McClane throws it in drive. The car BOLTS forward. McClane throws the steering wheel. THE TAXI FISHTAILS into a U-TURN, heading into TRAFFIC. ONCOMING CARS veer to the side, SCREECHING. MCCLANE throws the steering wheel again. The taxi hops the curb, SLIDING, TIRES WAILING , and ROARS down 72nd Street, now heading EAST.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: Walsh and Lambert pull away from the curb, giving chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TAXI blasts through the red-light at the intersection, narrowly missing -- 1) a baby carriage; 2) three guys in business suits; and, 3) two nuns (who are stil] praying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeus clutches the dashboard, eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Where the hell are you going!? I’m telling you: Ninth Avenue is the quickest way south.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: No it isn’t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh drives. Lambert’s on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: LAMBERT
dialogues.text: They're heading east on 72nd toward Central Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, another red light. Gridlock. Two TRUCKS in the intersection. Six, maybe seven feet between then. The taxi is approaching the intersection at 80 m.p.h. --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeus throws up his hands, waiting for the inevitable  38. impact. Which doesn’t come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi shoots between’the bumpers of the trucks,

dialogues.speaker: SCRAPING METAL, SHOOTING SPARKS --
dialogues.text: And flies into CENTRAL PARK on the CENTRAL PARK THRUWAY! THE IMPALA, trailing, doesn’t make it. It fishtails, attempting to stop, and runs up on the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh bangs on the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: WALSH
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: LAMBERT
dialogues.text: (into the radio) They went into the park. We lost ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi falls into traffic behind other cars and cabs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeus is staring malevolently at McClane.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: We're heading east.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: (holds up a finger) Don’t yell at me. (again, calmly:) The best way south isn’t Ninth Avenue, it’s through the park. I mean that in the... (jerks the wheel to the right) .+.literal sense...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TAXI hops the curb into the JOGGERS’ LANE. PEDESTRIANS, BYCYCLISTS, ROLLERBLADERS scramble and dive  39. out of the way as the taxi SMASHES through the wood railed fence and heads pell mell into -- THE SHEEP MEADOW. Now heading south! Through the park!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane is driving like hell across the sheep meadow! Zeus is catatonic.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: who, seconds ago, were relaxing, are now SCRAMBLING out of the way. : -- A GUY WITH A FRISBEE nearly catches a fender. -- A PASSIONATE COUPLE, NECKING ON A BLANKET, does a logroll out of the way. -- A WHITE-FACED, JUGGLING MIME tosses his juggling pins and runs.

dialogues.speaker: . ZEUS
dialogues.text: Are you aiming for these people?!

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: No. (looks in the rear view mirror) Well, except for that mime. The taxi flies on. Headed toward the softball fields. cUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two teams of out-of-shape BANKERS and LAWYERS are reliving their highschool glory days. The taxi RIPS into the infield, slinging dirt, missing the Baserunner by inches. It roars through the diamond, heading for the CENTRAL PARK SOUTH THRUWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane grips the wheel with white knuckles. Zeus is having a coronary.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: YOU’RE CRAZY, YOU KNOW THAT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi SMASHES through the wooden railing, now ENTERING the thruway, fishtailing through the jogging lane, and SLIDING headlong into traffic.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Okay, there’s Central Park South. How much time left? Zeus looks at his wristwatch.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Twenty-seven minutes.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: 72nd and Broadway to Central Park South in three minutes during rush hour? Got to be a record. McClane looks at Zeus. He glares at back. McClane floors it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TAXI flies out of Central Park onto 6th Avenue . (Avenue of the Americas) and runs straight into - AN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything has come to a dull, painful crawl. McClane scans the Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I was afraid of this. Midtown at rush hour’s murder.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: We need a firetruck.

dialogues.speaker: . MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I don’t see any fires.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: To follow...

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Gotcha. Done deal. McClane clicks on the c.b. Adjusts the band. SWITCHBOARD (v.0.) N.Y.P.D. May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: This is Lieutenant John McClane, N.Y.P.D. access I.D. number 7479, calling from a civilian transmittor. Give me an emergency dispatcher.  41. A pause, aS we hear a PHONE RINGING, then: EMERGENCY DISPATCHER (v.0.) 911 what’s your emergency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantically) Two officers down at the corner of 14th Street and 9th Avenue! We need an ambulance, this is an emergency! McClane slams down the radio and jerks the wheel, banging a right on 57th street. He turns to Zeus.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Emergency calls on the west side of Manhattan go to Roosevelt Hospital. (looks at Zeus) Which happens to be two blocks away.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: (getting it) What do you know....?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: You’re good at math, well I’m good at this shit. McClane guns it. The car flies down 57th Street.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 57TH
dialogues.text: Uneventful. A NURSE wheels a PATIENT up the entrance ramp. Suddenly the hospital’s E.M.S. (Emergency Medical Services) GARAGE DOOR (located on 9th Avenue) rolls open and an E.M.S. AMBULANCE VAN roars out onto 9TH AVENUE, heading south, its SIREN BLARING WHOOOP WHOOP WHOOP.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: comes flying around the corner, fishtailing onto 9th Avenue, falling in behind the ambulance!

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: That’s the ticket - pick up some blockers, then go for the endzone. McClane punches the accelerator, following the

dialogues.speaker: 9TH AVE. DOWN THE WEST SIDE
dialogues.text: All the way down 9th avenue, cars pull to the curb. The sidestreet traffic halts. As -- The AMBULANCE, siren WAILING, roars through intersection after intersection, running interference for MCCLANE AND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane drops the hammer. 40 miles an hour. 50. 60.. Block after block flies by. Zeus looks at McClane, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Why fourteenth Street? If you'd said Wall Street, we’d have them the whole way.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Emergency calls below fourteenth Street are taken by a different hospital -- St. Lukes. zEUS Well aren’t you one slick muthafucka. McClane guns the car and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AMBULANCE skids to a stop in the intersection. Paramedics scramble out, looking frantically around for the “officers down."

dialogues.speaker: INT. TAXI.- DAY
dialogues.text: McClane veers to avoid the ambulance in front of hin. He clears it and accelerates through the intersection.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: How much time? Zeus looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: It’s 5:02. We’re half-way there with eighteen minutes to go. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I dunno. We’re hitting traffic again. (thinks a moment) Fuck this. McClane bangs a left on 12th Street.

dialogues.speaker: . ZEUS
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: You’ll see. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The West Village. A sign on the subway entrance: SHERIDAN SQUARE. The taxi pulls over in front of the Subway stairs. INT. TAXI - MCCLANE AND Zeus - DAY

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Time?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Sixteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Sheridan Square with sixteen minutes left means we made it here in fourteen minutes, right?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: So we’re probably ahead of the train, right?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Probably. (beat) You’re not thinking what I think you’re thinking.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: That’s exactly what I’m thinking. McClane gets out of the taxi. Leans in the window:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I‘m getting on that train.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: You‘re outta your mind.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: It makes sense. You get to the phone by 5:20: I/’11 find the bomb and get rid of it in the tunnel. If you fail, I’ve got you covered. If I fail, you’re covering for me - we/re cutting the odds in half.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, and what if I don’t get to the phone by 5:20, and you don’t find the bomb and get rid of it.

dialogues.speaker: . MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Then I’m fucked. (unholsters his gun) You know how to use this? McClane hands Zeus the gun; Zeus looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: I thought I wasn’t on police business.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I’m deputizing you.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: My lucky fuckin’ day. Zeus reluctantly takes the gun.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: ‘See you on Wall Street. And McClane runs. down the stairs into the subway!

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: McClane! Goddamn it.... Zeus watches McClane race off. He tosses the gun on the seat, then throws it in drive and speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane dashes down the stairs to the platform. He jumps the turnstile and sees -- The NUMBER 5 TRAIN’S DOORS are closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4s. McClane turns, vaults the turnstiles, and runs back up to the street level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sprints down the sidewalk on 9th Avenue, arriving at VENTILATION GRATE ABOVE THE SUBWAY TRACK. He kneels and lifts up the grate, tossing it aside. He lowers himself into the ventilation hole, hanging there by his fingers. THE SUBWAY train passes beneath him, still moving slowly, accelerating into the tunnel and -- MCCLANE releases his grip, falling onto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the ROOF OF THE DRIVER’S CAR. INT. SUBWAY TRAIN - DRIVER’S CAR The SUBWAY DRIVER looks up, astonished at -- MCCLANE, outside, clinging to the door of the driver’s car, BANGING on the window. The driver opens the door; McClane slides inside. He flips out his detective’s shield.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Just keep driving and stay on schedule. McClane opens the back door of the driver’s compartment and enters the first subway car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi, Zeus at the wheel, flies through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeus looks up through the windshield at -- Zeus’ POV - WALL STREET’S WORLD TRADE TOWERS loom over the sky-line, just ahead. BACK TO SCENE - Zeus lowers his eyes to the street. OH MY GOD -- A TRACTOR TRAILER is in the intersection ahead of hin.  46. Zeus slams on the brakes. The taxi screeches to a stop at the light. Zeus nervously taps his fingers on the wheel, waiting for the truck to make the corner. Suddenly the back seat door of the taxi opens. Zeus whirls around, staring at -- A GUY IN A BUSINESS SUIT sitting in the backseat. Zeus has picked up a passenger! And he’s a snotty guy:

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESS GUY
dialogues.text: 112 Wall Street, please.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: You’ve got to get out, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESS GUY
dialogues.text: No. Your light’s on. (beat) Let me make this simple: take me to Wall Street or I’1l have you’re medallion suspended. (beat) What, you don’t like white people? Zeus glares at the guy. Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: . ZEUS
dialogues.text: Fine. 112 Wall Street it is. THE LIGHT turns GREEN. Zeus FLOORS it. The taxi sprints through the intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train is rocketing through the tunnel. McClane comes through the doors connecting two cars. It’s not very crowded. Some STOCKBROKERS. A few LADIES. He moves down the aisle, stooping low, looking underneath the rows of molded fiberglass subway seats. He pauses. Looks up at -- A LADY. She adjusts her legs. She thinks he’s trying to look up her dress. McClane hurriedly moves the length of the car. Goes through doors into the next car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets are filled with five o’clock commuters. We HEAR an ENGINE GUNNING. The taxi ROARS up at 50°miles an hour and careens to the curb. Zeus gets out and runs down the steps to THE WALL ST. SUBWAY STATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Business Guy in the backseat stares straight ahead, eyes like saucers. (One can only imagine what the rest of the trip was like.) :

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: One of the larger stations in Manhattan, distinguished by a HUGE DIGITAL CLOCK and even bigger DIGITAL STOCKS AND BONDS QUOTRON, both of which hang from the ceiling of the train platform, giving Wall Street commuters up- to-the-minute market prices. At the south end of the long platform is the’ WALL STREET NEWS KIOSK. Next to that is a public TELEPHONE. AT THE TURNSTILES - ZEUS runs up to the turnstiles and jumps over one. A TRANSIT COP, eating a donut, sees him.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSIT COP
dialogues.text: Hey!! Zeus doesn’t look back. He keeps right on going. The transit cop hops over a turnstile and gives chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeus runs through the crowd, smashing into people like a pin-ball.. Overhead, the HUGE DIGITAL CLOCK reads: 5:18. Zeus reaches the PAY PHONES by the news kiosk, huffing and puffing. A BUSINESSMAN stands in front of the Phone, fishing for quarters in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane is frantic now, moving down the aisle of a car, looking under the seats. He looks at his watch. INSERT - MCCLANE’S WATCH: 5:19 BACK TO SCENE - MCCLANE wipes sweat from his eyes. Continues into the next-to- last car, bending, stooping,  48. looking under the seats. There. There it is. Something under the seat. McClane rushes to it. GOMMUTERS stare at him as he gets on his hands and knees and looks under the seat. A BUNDLE OF PLASTIQUE EXPLOSIVE, a black box transmittor attached to it, antennae protruding, is fixed to the underside of the seat with boxing tape. Very slooowwly, with sweat streaming down his face, McClane begins to rip the tape off. He finally unleashes the explosive, stands up, and begins walking, tenderly, toward the back of the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeus is by the phone, nervously watching the clock. The Businessman is fishing for quarters in his pocket. THE DIGITAL CLOCK flips to 5:20. . And the BUSINESSMAN finds his goddamn quarters! He begins sliding them in the money slot of the phone. zEUS) Uhh, sir, I need that phone.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: Drop dead. Zeus pulls his gun and points it at the Businessman.

dialogues.speaker: GET AWAY FROM THE PHONE.
dialogues.text: The Businessman looks at Zeus and, alarmed, begins to back away from the phone. We HEAR the CLICK OF A REVOLVER behind Zeus. And then: VOICE (v.0.)

dialogues.speaker: DROP THE GUN AND GET YOUR HANDS UP
dialogues.text: Zeus freezes. Drops the gun. THE TRANSIT cop stands ten paces away, revolver cocked. COMMUTERS on the platform run for cover. WOMEN SCREAM. Zeus looks at the Transit Cop. Looks at the phone. And the PHONE RINGS. Zeus slowly raises his hands. The Transit Cop grabs him by the collar, spinning hin,
pushing him face-first against the wall. The phone RINGS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I have to answer that.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSIT COP
dialogues.text: Shut up. The PHONE RINGS for the third time. And just then -- emanating from the Subway Tunnel - WE HEAR THE RUMBLE OF THE TRAIN coming into the station. zeus stares at the phone, panicking. And it RINGS for the FOURTH TIME. The Cop spreads Zeus’s legs and begins to pat him down. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane is moving through the last car with the bomb, SCREAMING at PASSENGERS.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: This is a bomb. MOVE. GET OUT OF HERE. THE PASSENGERS, panicking and HOLLERING, scramble through the door into the front cars. McClane gets to the back door of the last car. He looks out the window. The TRAIN TRACKS fall away from the moving train. He sets the plastique on a seat and jerks the door handle. It’s JAMMED. McClane strains. Looks at his watch. It’s 5:20. He strains with all his might. It won’t open! cUuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop is patting down Zeus’s legs, frisking him. The phone rings again. The fifth ring. The sixth. Zeus’s RIGHT HAND (plastered against the wall) inches toward the phone receiver. He grabs it off the cradle, whips around, and SMASHES it against the Cop’s temple. The cop goes down, writhing in pain, his revolver falling on the platform. Zeus grabs the gun and trains it on the cop, holding him at bay.
The phone is dangling from its metal cord. Zeus grabs it and SHOUTS into it:

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: YEAH. I’M HERE. After a pause:

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Yes. You are. (beat) Where is McClane?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: He couldn’t make it.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: The rules were you both had to be there. You have to learn to follow instructions. I’m afraid this is non-compliance. Good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Simon, wait.... , CLICK. ZEUS looks at the phone in terror and turns to -- THE FIRST CAR OF THE TRAIN emerging from the tunnel. ZEUS cowers in anticipation of the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down! The Businessman and the Transit Cop look at Zeus, confused, as if he’s a lunatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - The SUBWAY CAR is entering the station. We FOCUS on THE WHEELS OF THE CAR inching toward -- An ELECTRONIC DETONATOR attached to the subway track. It’s a wire stretched across the rail, connecting two “ circuit breakers; the passing of the first subway car will cut the wire, and thus trigger the detonator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane gives up on the door handle. He bhrusts his elbow through the glass window of the subway door. He grips the bundle of plastique and -- FLINGS it through the smashed aperture in the window. THE PLASTIQUE falls on the tracks and --  §1. MCCLANE dives forward, sliding across the car’s floor to the other end of the car. He covers up, but -- NOTHING HAPPENS. MCLANE, confused, uncovers and looks around as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ~~ THE WHEELS OF THE FIRST CAR roll over the wire of the detonator, breaking the circuit. THE DETONATOR flashes, sending a signal to -- °

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the bundle of PLASTIQUE EXPLOSIVE which McClane flung from the train. . The plastique DETONATES. A HOLOCAUSTIC EXPLOSION erupts in the tunnel, knocking the train’s back car off the tracks and tipping it over. The EXPLOSION blasts a hole in the CEILING OF THE SUBWAY TUNNEL, creating A CRATER in the middle of Wall Street. ON THE SUBWAY STATION PLATFORM ~- THE FIREBALL erupts from the tunnel opening with fury and impact, knocking - ZEUS, the BUSINESSMAN, the TRANSIT COP and other COMMUTERS to the platform floor. Then it is over. COMMUTERS are running for the exits, SCREAMING. The CEILING SPRINKLERS have come on. The TRANSIT COP is on his knees, searching for his gun. zeus, groggy, gets to his feet, the sprinklers showering her. He peers through heavy smoke at --

dialogues.speaker: THE TUNNEL OPENING
dialogues.text: is emerging from the tunnel opening past the derailed train. He comes through the smoke and train wreckage. It’s McClane. His forehead is cut and bloody. He climbs up onto the station platform and walks up to Zeus and the transit cop. He flips open his N.Y.P.D. SHIELD for the cop.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I’m acop. He’s with me. McClane and Zeus look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Had you covered all the way.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Tell me about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a HUGE CRATER in the middle of Wall Street. FIREMEN are spraying chemical fire retardant into the cratered hole. The intersection is a tangle of firetrucks, ambulances and police cruisers. The area around the crater and subway station is closed off with POLICE BARRICADES. T.V. NEWS TEAMS conduct interviews, jockey for position. The sidewalks are filled with rubbernecking STOCKBROKERS and LAWYERS.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND BARRICADES
dialogues.text: MCCLANE and Zeus sit. An E.M.S. PARAMEDIC applies a butterfly bandage to McClane’s cut forehead. Zeus is drinking coffee, staring into the smoke, watching PARAMEDICS carry off the injured. - Lambert and Walsh come up to then.

dialogues.speaker: LAMBERT
dialogues.text: Two broken bones, a couple concussions, an old guy’s pacemaker stopped and a pregnant girl’s water broke (smiles) And nobody died.

dialogues.speaker: WALSH
dialogues.text: (shakes head) Shit, I don’t know how you did it, but you did it. (Walsh kneels in front . of McClane) John, but. you've got to help us on this... Think. Some guy who’s got it in for you. Some kid you beat up in highschool, who knows.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: (the strain showing on his face) Ricky, I’ve been thinking about it. COBB (0.s.) John. McClane turns and looks. COBB is outside the barricades, motioning to hin.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: (to Zeus) You too. McClane and Zeus get up- and move past the barricades, following Cobb. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark VAN is parked in an alleyway down the street from the blast site. TWO MEN in dark suits and sunglasses stand by the van. Their dress and demeanor indicate they are federal agents. McClane and Zeus follow Cobb to the van. : One of the dark-suited men opens the door for them. Cobb cliimbs in; McClane and Zeus follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane and Zeus get in and sit next to Cobb. In the back of the van is a BANK OF COMPUTERS and PHONE MODUMS manned by a young F.B.I. AGENT. IN THE SEAT OPPOSITE are TWO MEN, 40’s, staring at them. ANDREW CROSS and WILLIAM JARVIS are deadly serious, career G-men. A BRIEFCASE sits on Jarvis’ lap.

dialogues.speaker: CROSS
dialogues.text: Detective McClane? (extends hand) Andrew Cross, Federal Bureau of Investigation. (nods to Zeus) Mr. Carver. McClane and Zeus shake Cross’ hand. McClane turns to Jarvis.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: You also with the Bureau?

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: (shakes his head, extends hand) William Jarvis, Central Intelligence Administration. Call me Bill.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: The C.I.A. and the F.B.I. Why’s the A-Team here, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The situation’s worse than we thought, John.  S4.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: That’s saying a lot, considering the fuckin’ guy just blew up a subway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective McClane, four years ago the communist bloc’s top field operative, an East German, was caught attempting to assassinate the leaders of the new democratic regime in Romania. He was sentenced to life imprisonment in a Bucharest jail. Six weeks ago he escaped. We have positive confirmation he’s pierced United States soil.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: What’s this got to do with me? I’ve never been to Germany, east or west, and It’d take me a mintute to find Romania on a map. Cobb exchanges a look with Jarvis and Cross.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: Detective McClane, is the name Gruber familiar to you? A pause. McClane’s eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLAIN
dialogues.text: Yes. Jarvis flicks open his briefcase and removes a C.I.A. INTELLIGENCE DOSSIER. He closes the briefcase and sets the dossier on his lap. It is stamped with a government seal: “PRIORITY TOP SECRET." ‘Jarvis turns the dossier around and opens the cover. CLOSE ON MCCLANE as he looks at the dossier. His jaw muscles tighten; his eyes darken.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: Hans Gruber. Correct? Now we see -- INSERT - INSIDE THE DOSSIER is A PHOTOGRAPH of HANS GRUBER (played by Alan Rickman in "Die Hard.") standing in front of East Berlin’s Brandenberg Gate, smiling, his arm around someone we cannot see because of the photograph jis obscured by a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: CROSS
dialogues.text: Five years ago, Hans Gruber tried to steal 600 million dollars in bearer bonds from the Nakatomi Exchange in Los Angeles. -You thwarted the theft and killed hin.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: Did you know that Gruber was a member of East Germany’s counter- intelligence community? Did you know, detective McClane, that he had a brother? A younger brother named... He removes the sheet of paper from the photograph -- INSERT ~ THE DOSSIER PHOTOGRAPH - Hans Gruber’s arm is around a YOUNGER MAN, also smiling, a younger and more sinister version of Hans. JARVIS (v.0.) +..Simon?

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: MCCLANE stares at SIMON GRUBER, the brother of the man he killed. His mind is racing. He swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Tell me about this guy. Jarvis flips through the dossier. ‘ He reads Simon Gruber’s intelligence report as McClane flips through more PHOTOGRAPHS.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: Simon Gruber. Born February 13, 1952 in Dresden. Conscripted in the East German army, 1970. PHOTOGRAPH - SIMON GRUBER in a military uniforn.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: Court-martialed 1972 for assaulting a superior officer. He was offered the firing squad or service in their secret police. Suffice it to say he took the latter. PHOTOGRAPHS - SIMON GRUBER exiting an automobile in the Place de la Concorde in Paris.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: What was his job?  56.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: Assassin, and a very good one. In 1976 he neutralized our best agent. Gruber has an 1.Q. of 187. He’s ' fluent in seventeen languages and impossible to’contain. He comes and goes as he wishes. PHOTOGRAPHS - SIMON GRUBER on a bridge over the Danube in Vienna. SIMON GRUBER moving through a crowded street a in Budapest.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: : He is clinically psychotic. In 1980, the Israelis tried to take him ~ out. The agent missed, but killed Gruber’s lover. PHOTOGRAPH - SIMON GRUBER with a BEAUTIFUL YOUNG WOMAN in a cafe in Amsterdam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two weeks later the Israeli agent, most of him, was found in a hotel closet in Prague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: \ Most of him? i JARVIS His head was placed neatly in the middle of the bed, on a pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, fuck me.... (rises) . This has been fun, fellahs, but I think I hear my mother calling....

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: Sit down, Mr. Carver. Simon Gruber : has come to New York and he’s not very happy with Detective McClane. Or you, for that matter. Because of the use of explosive, we’re inclined to think Simon’s with this man -- PHOTOGRAPH - A. dark, compact MAN on a street in Eastern Europe.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: Mathias Targo, Hungarian, Gruber’s protege. Easily the terrorist community’s most dangerous explosives expert.  57. There’s a KNOCK on the van door.

dialogues.speaker: CROSS
dialogues.text: Yes? The van door opens. Detective RICKY WALSH leans in the door with a grim expression. Says to Cobb:

dialogues.speaker: WALSH
dialogues.text: Arthur... (hands Cobb a cellular phone) -..it’s him again. Everybody stares at the phone in Cobb’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Hello, Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: CROSS
dialogues.text: (turns to a young F.B.I. agent in the back of the van) Tommy. Speaker.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Simon, I’m putting you on speaker phone. Cobb hands the phone to a the young F.B.I. agent (TOMMY) in the back of the van, who puts the cellular phone ina modum with a speaker capability. We HEAR SIMON:

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Let’s see, I bet there’s John McClane, and Zeus, and who from the

dialogues.speaker: F.B.I....
dialogues.text: A pause. Cross clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: CROSS
dialogues.text: This is Deputy Director Andrew Cross, Simon.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Deputy Director? I’m insulted. And who am I missing....?

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: William Jarvis, Simon.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Bill, Bill, Bill. The last time I saw you was through the telescopic sight of a Reugers rifle. Do you still wear thdse horn-rimmed glasses, they’re so unbecoming. Everyone looks at Jarvis’ horn-rimmed glasses. Jarvis grits his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Congratulations, John, two for two. I thought you might be getting bored so I’ve put twenty-eight hundred . pounds of C-4 plastique explosive in one of the 246 schools in Greater New York. It’s set with a timer....

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Excuse me, did you say twenty-eight hundred pounds?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Yes. Please don’t interrupt again. It’s timed to explode in exactly three hours, at 3:00 p.m. If any child is seen exiting any of the schools, I will detonate the bomb by remote control.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: What‘’s the Simon Says part?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Hello, John. Simon says: McClane and his new friend go to the payphone in Washington Square Park. I will call you in twenty minutes. If you do what you’re told I will tell you where the bomb is and how to disarm it.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Simon, wait. Which school?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: If I told you that it wouldn’t be fun, would it? By the way: the bomb’s detonator is set to receive the police ban frequency. I/’d avoid using your radios.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Simon, wait.... CLICK. Everyone stares at each other.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Twenty-eight hundred pounds of C-4. Ten pounds of the stuff can level a building. Where would he get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don’t know this man.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: He’s bluffing.
