dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: I gaurantee you he isn’t. There's A KNOCK on the van door. The door opens. Charlie Weiss from the N.Y.P.D. bomb squad sticks his head in the van.

dialogues.speaker: WEISS
dialogues.text: Arthur, we traced the explosive from the bomb in Central Park. The manufacturer’s in Grand Rapids, Michigan. I called ‘em. They had a break-in over the week-end. (beat) You won’t believe this. Twenty- eight hundred pounds of C=-4 high- density plastique explosive. That’s the equivalent of what we dropped on Hiroshima. Everyone looks at each other.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: McClane. The riddle.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: What riddle?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Simon gave us a riddle. The answer was twenty-eight hundred.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: You’ve got twenty minutes, John. When you get something, call the police switchboard. They’1ll find me. McClane turns to Zeus:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You up for this?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Do I have a choice?
McClane and Zeus exit the van, hustling down the alleyway for Washington Square Park. Cobb turns to Cross and Jarvis:

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: I’m going to need federal help here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB is behind the barricades. All the POLICE, FIREMEN, and E.M.S. workers are crowded in front of hin.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Ricky, get the media out of here. Walsh moves off yelling at the T.V. NEWS TEAMS.

dialogues.speaker: WALSH
dialogues.text: You’ve gotta evacuate the area. NOW, people... Cobb continues:

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: I want every available man -- transit cops, Triboro Authority cops, airport cops, the fire department, and E.M.S. personnel. I want every school cordoned off. No kid can leave. And don’t use your radios! And don’t tell the press or we'll have the biggest panic in New York since the blackout in ‘76! The cops scurry off. Cobb mutters to no one in particular.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Goddamn this guy....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are on rooftop 25 stories above the blast site. Below, on Wall Street, the cops are scurrying off to try to find the bomb in the school. A MAN is at the edge of the roof, looking down. He~- turns away and we are face-to-face with -- SIMON GRUBER, age 42. Everything about this man is disconcerting: his physicality, the way he moves, the
way he lights a cigarette. His eyes are very blue, yet dead, like a shark. His smile is ironic, detached.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: They bought it. MATHIAS TARGO, next to Simon, nods. Targo is Hungarian, 30’s, Compact and deadly. He never smiles. Simon flips open a cellular phone, punches numbers.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Go. Simon and Targo turn and look north, up Greenwich Avenue, toward Tribeca. A mile away they can see -- SIMON’S POV = FROM ROOFTOP VANTAGE - TEN HUGE INDUSTRIAL DUMPTRUCKS wheel around a corner and head down Greenwich Ave. toward Wall Street.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Simon pockets the cellular phone and turns to Targo, who wears a grim expression.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Did someone die? Simon smiles; Targo maintains his grim expression.

dialogues.speaker: TARGO
dialogues.text: He got on the train, Simon. The bomb detonated in the wrong place.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: It’s close enough.

dialogues.speaker: TARGO
dialogues.text: You have more in common with your brother than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TARGO
dialogues.text: You both underestimate this man. Simon’s smile vanishes. He is instantly cold, detached.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Keep your opinions about my brother - and me - to yourself, Mathias. Simon turns and walks off. Targo watches him.  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An N.Y.P.D. airport security Captain hangs up a phone and turns to his sergeant:

dialogues.speaker: AIRPORT POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Release every man you can spare and get over to the Manhattan bureau. They’ve got a situation over there - and don’t use your radios! The sergeant hurries off and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An N.Y.P.D. Bridge and Tunnel Captain screams at his SUBORDINATES, who hustle for the door.

dialogues.speaker: TRIBORO POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Move, people, move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An emergency briefing. The room is filled with uniformed cops and detectives, some still entering. COBB is in the front of the room with a huge map of Greater New York, breaking down assignments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police motor pool garage - a line of a hundred N.Y¥.P.D. cruisers. As each cruiser exits the garage, the cop at the wheel i 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The switching center for all police communications. A row of THIRTY DISPATCHERS sit at their phones. The pace is frantic. Obviously, the volume of calls has just drastically increased. WANDA SHEPHERD, the head dispatcher, a wiry, chainsmoking, frenetic woman, watches her staff. She turns and walks down the corridor, running into --  63. Sgt. JOHN TURLEY, N.Y¥.P.D. Chief of Internal Communications. Turley’s natural calm is the mirror opposite of Shepherd’s natural frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Sergeant, we’ve just quadrupled our volume in five minutes. What the hell is...?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN TURLEY
dialogues.text: Stop. Let me explain. For the rest of the day we're handling all the department’s communication.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: What do you mean all communication.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN TURLEY
dialogues.text: We’re shutting down the police ban. All calls will be handled through this switchboard.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: And I’m gonna marry Donald Trump! Do you have any idea what kind of . volume we’re talking about....? Turley takes her arm and pulls her toward the dispatch room.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN TURLEY
dialogues.text: Stop. We will deal with this as best we can. Do you want a valium? They move inside the dispatch room and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . The park at the bottom of 5th Avenue. It is mid-day and packed. Baby strollers, rollerbladers, a few artists. A Juilliard violinist plays for quarters. McClane and Zeus come across the park; they stop at the phones next to the fountain in the park’s center.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: We wait. They stand there by the phone in silence. Zeus is eyeing McClane.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: You know, I thought I recognized you. Saw you’re name in the paper. Read the article too. Mr. Distinguished Service Medal. So who the fuck is John McClane?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: You read the article.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Fuck the article. Who’s John McClane?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: He’s forty years old. He’s a cop. He’s divorced because he’s a cop. And somebody’s trying to kill him. (beat) Who is Zeus Carver?

dialogues.speaker: . ZEUS
dialogues.text: He’s twenty-nine. He owns an appliance shop. He’s divorced because - none o’ your fuckin’ business. And somebody’s trying to kill him because he saved some white cop’s ass. They eye each other.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: You think for five minutes we can get around this black white thing?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Sure. Fine. Let’s "get around it." What the fuck does that mean.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: It means you've got a beef with me because I’m white. You want to tell me why?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: If you have to ask the question, you won't understand the answer. They eye each other. Then they talk at once, the pace and intensity increasing:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Let’s get something straight...

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: -».-yeah, you’re good at that...  Silence. 65.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: +..-I don’t own any slaves...

dialogues.speaker: _ ZEUS
dialogues.text: ..-Anh man, you’re not going to shovel this bullshit at me...

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: .+..™My ancestors, to my knowledge, didn’t own any slaves....

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: «.-you think I haven’t heard this shit before...? -

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: ...-And I don’t give a rat’s left testicle if you’re black, or white, or green...

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: ++.let me get something straight...

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: «-.or fucking purple...

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: ...suck my dick, McClane. They glare at each other. The phone RINGS. They continue staring each other down. Neither moves.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: You gonna answer that? McClane grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Multiplication is vexation, Division is as bad; The Rule of Three, doth puzzle me, And practice drives me mad. (beat) Can you both hear me? McClane motions to Zeus, who comes up close. They share the phone receiver. Reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: The top of the phone booth.  66. Zeus takes the phone. . McClane reaches to the roof of the phonebooth. His hands lower, holding a CARDBOARD BOX. “SIMON Open it. . McClane sets the box on the ground and opens it. McClane and Zeus stare at -- INSIDE THE BOX - A WEIGHING SCALE (the household variety) attached to a DIGITALLY TIMED DETONATOR.

dialogues.speaker: . SIMON
dialogues.text: Turn toward the fountain. (McClane and Zeus turn; look) Do you see the two jugs?

dialogues.speaker: PANNING THE EDGE OF THE FOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: We move past a couple kids, an old guy smoking a cigarette...TWO PLASTIC JUGS with HANDLES sit by the lip of the fountain. .

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: One is a five gallon jug, the other is a three gallon jug. Simon Says fill one of the jugs with exactly four gallons of water and place it on the scale. McClane and Zeus exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Why should we do that?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: That exact weight of water will stop the detonator attached to the scale.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Detonator? Where’s the bomb? MCCLANE’S looking over Zeus’ shoulder. His face darkens. He says under his breath....

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Over there, Zeus. Zeus whirls around and looks at -- THEIR POV - ACROSS THE POND - A CHILDRENS’ PARK about 50 yards away. A swingset, a jungle gym, a  67. teeter-totter, etc. A GROUP OF KIDS and THEIR MOTHERS and NANNIES are playing. The kids are tear-assing around the place. Under the jungle gym, A SAMSONITE BRIEFCASE glints in the sunshine. BACK TO SCENE - Simon continues:

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Exactly four gallons in one of the jugs. I emphasize exactly. You have twenty minutes. Mclane and Zeus look down in horror as -- The DIGITAL TIMER on the detonator flicks on. It reads: 20:00. Then flips to 19:59 and begins counting down: 19:58, 19:57, 19:56....

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Simon, wait, how are we going to...?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: If I told you it wouldn’t be fun? Would it John. CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: SIMON clicks off his cellular phone; we see that he’s on street level as we WIDEN TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON and TARGO, both wearing hardhats and suits and ties. They walk toward -- TWO UNIFORMED POLICE OFFICERS guarding the barricaded perimeter of the blast site from pedestrians. Alli _ the ; . vehi have been deverted to deal with the bomb in the school. In the b.g. the TEN INDUSTRIAL DUMPTRUCKS are pulling up to the site and parking next to the blast site. Simon approaches the cops. He opens his wallet and flashes proper credentials.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (American accent) Bob Thompson, City Engineer. (looks at the crater Holy Toledo, somebody had fun.

dialogues.speaker: COP 1
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ unbelievable ehh? What can I do for you Mr. Thompson?  68.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: The mayor wants this train up and running - that’s where I come in. We're going to clear the rubble and gauge the extent of damage.

dialogues.speaker: COP 2
dialogues.text: That was quick.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Wall Street, son. When rich people want something, they don’t wait. — coP 1 (laughs) Come on, we’ll take you down. The two cops lead Simon and Targo down the station steps. Simon stops. Targo continues behind the cops, pulling A SILENCED HANDGUN from a shoulder holster. Targo and the cops round the corner, descending to the Platform. We hear SILENCED GUNSHOTS, then the sound of bodies collapsing. - TARGO comes back up the staircase, nodding to Simon. SIMON turns to the dumptrucks and motions. TWO MEN get out of the lead dumptruck, dressed as N.Y.P.D. patrolmen. They take the dead policemens’ places behind the barricades. MR. LUCK, the driver of the lead dumptruck, backs up to the cratered hole in Wall Street. The bed of his truck rises, dumping out PORTABLE STEEL RAMPING GIRDERS. Several other DUMPTRUCK DRIVERS leave their trucks; they pick up the ramping girders and begin erecting a ramp from the street level to the subway track below. A DUMPTRUCK backs up to the crater. OTHER DRIVERS * offload a TUNNEL DIGGER (used in mining operations - a machine that digs huge holes), and a MASSIVE CRATE. cUT TO: EXT. WASHINGTON SQUARE PARK - DAY . The DIGITAL TIMER on the detonator (attached to the scale) is counting: 15:32, 15:31, 15:30, etc. McClane has the jugs in hand.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Let’s start over. Four gallons in one of the jugs. I don’t get it.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Me neither.

dialogues.speaker: _ MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Obviously we can’t get four gallons in the three ‘gallon jug.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Obviously.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I know! Pour the three gallon jug full, then pour it into the five. Now there’s EXACTLY three gallons in’ the five gallon jug, right?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Right....and then...?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Uhh...fill the three gallon jug a third of the way, giving us one more gallon...

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: No, no, no, Simon said EXACTLY four gallons. We can’t eyebal] the last gallon. Look, don’t say you know, unless you know. We have to be precise.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Like your coke bottle idea?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Drop it, McClane....

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: -..no, ¢’mon, let’s find a sixteen ounce coke bottle in the trash and fill the five gallon thirty-two times. That’s real fuckin’ precise, Zeus....

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: ...I said grop it, McClane....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FAKE COPS are standing guard. The DRIVERS are building the steel ramp into the crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the tunnel, 50 yards from the station platform.  70. SIMON and TARGO stand on the tracks, watching -- THE TUNNEL DIGGER spewing dirt out of 10’ by 6’ aperture that’s been jackhammered in the concrete wall of the subway tunnel. It backS out. The TUNNEL DIGGER OPERATOR turns to Simon:

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL DIGGER OPERATOR
dialogues.text: We’re at the armor plate. Simon nods to Targo. Targo crowbars open the HUGE CRATE we saw unloaded from the dumptruck, revealing a six-foot diameter, diamond- tipped HYDRAULIC DRILL mounted on treads. He gets behind the controls and starts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JACKHAMMERED HOLE in the subway wall. The hole is lit with battery powered construction lamps. INSIDE THE HOLE - MR. LUCK (the lead dumptruck driver) is on his belly next to an ELECTRICAL CONDUIT the size of a log. The conduit’s steel casing is ripped open, exposing HUNDREDS OF SEPARATE ELECTRICAL WIRES. Mr. Luck cuts and clamps a WIRE from the conduit onto a large black box with numerous gauges labeled: SEISMIC DETECTION MONITOR. He prepares to snip the OLD WIRE ~-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO FEDERAL MARSHALS sit behind a bank of monitors. VIDEO MONITORS show the interior of VAULTS. Next to these are SEISMIC DETECTION MONITORS

dialogues.speaker: FEDERAL MARSHAL 1
dialogues.text: Going to the kitchen. Coffee?

dialogues.speaker: FEDERAL MARSHAL 2
dialogues.text: (turns in his chair) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. LUCK snips the wire and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ~~ the seismic detection monitors briefly wobble. Federal Marshal 2 sees the glitch out of the corner of his eye and whirls around in his chair.  71.

dialogues.speaker: FEDERAL MARSHAL 2
dialogues.text: Whoah, what was that?

dialogues.speaker: FEDERAL MARSHAL 1
dialogues.text: (alarmed) What was what? The SEISMIC DETECTION MONITORS appear normal.

dialogues.speaker: . FEDERAL MARSHAL 2
dialogues.text: Nothin’. Federal Marshal 1, satisfied, exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ramp is now fully constructed. The DUMPTRUCKS are backing down the ramp onto the subway tracks. Each DRIVER gets out and climbs into the bed of his dumptruck, releasing the tailgate. They drive SKID STEERS (compact, powerful, earthmoving vehicles) off the trucks. They drive the skid steers down the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon is looking down the subway tracks. DOWN THE TUNNEL -- a FLASHLIGHT flashes on, then off.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Now, Mathias. (flips open his cellular phone; dials) You’re time has come, Nigel. INSIDE THE DRILLING HOLE - MATHIAS TARGO, seated behind the hydraulic drill, operates levers. The ENORMOUS DIAMOND-TIPPED BIT lifts up and pushes forward into a WALL OF TUNGSTEN STEEL ARMOUR PLATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modest, non-descript bank lobby. It’s quiet. Little activity. No customers. THREE GUARDS are on duty: one behind the front desk; Two by a metal detector in the corridor to the elevators. THREE BUSINESSMEN enter the lobby, carrying briefcases. They speak with English accents.

dialogues.speaker: ENGLISH BUSINESSMAN 1, (NIGEL)
dialogues.text: I don’t care what the exchange rate is, Freddy - the deal should rest on it’s financial merits.  o~ 72. They move toward the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: DESK GUARD
dialogues.text: Gentlemen? (the businessmen turn) What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: ENGLISH BUSINESSMAN 1, (FREDDY)
dialogues.text: Thank-you. We're waiting for a colleague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarog’s drill WHINES within the drilling hole. SIMON turns and nods to SIX MEN with silenced machine pistols who move into the drilling hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARS OF GOLD BULLION on PALLETS are stacked floor to ceiling. Suddenly the walls vibrate. The floor shakes until the whole room is rattling and -- TARGO’S HYDRAULIC DRILL BIT explodes through the wall. Red LIGHTS flare. A siren sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Federal Marshals stare, astonished and startled, at the VISUAL MONITORS as the drill bit breaks through!

dialogues.speaker: FEDERAL MARSHAL 1
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.... Federal Marshal 1 stabs the EMERGENCY BUTTON. An ALARM CLANGS. Federal Marshal 2 speaks into a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: FEDERAL MARSHAL 2
dialogues.text: Breach in the main vault. I repeat, we have a breach in the main vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRENS WAIL in the floors below. The LOBBY GUARDS react with alarn. The ENGLISH BUSINESSMEN pull silenced pistols from their coats and shoot the guards. They drag the corpses into the back corridor. One of the Businessmen, (NIGEL), strips off his suit jacket and shirt, revealing a FEDERAL MARSHAL’S UNIFORM
underneath. He walks back to the lobby, scooping up the hat of a dead guard. He puts the hat on. The OTHER TWO BUSINESSMEN get in the elevator and descend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight heavily armed FEDERAL MARSHALS run down the corridor. They assemble around the vault door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federal Marshal 1 punches a code into a keypad: it is the COMBINATION for the vault door.

dialogues.speaker: FEDERAL MARSHAL 1
dialogues.text: (into a mike) I’m opening the door. We HEAR the Monitor Room’s door open. The Federal Marshals look up and cringe. PHHHTT! PHHHITT! Both are shot dead in their chairs.

dialogues.speaker: _INT. BANK
dialogues.text: TUMBLERS electronically roll and a motor HUMS. The vault door begins to slowly open. Around the vault door, the team of Federal Marshals, breathing heavily, brace for a firefight. FOUR DISKS scuttle across the tile floor. Coming from behind them. The FEDERAL MARSHALS stare at the disks. They EXPLODE, spewing gas. The Marshal’s recoil, then collapse, unconscious. THE TWO ENGLISH BUSINESSMEN step toward the vault door. They move inside the vault, coming face-to-face with -- “INT. BANK - MAIN VAULT -- their comrades entering from the drilled hole. Then, supremely, comes Simon Gruber. He stands there, blue eyes flashing, staring at -- 34 PERCENT OF THE WORLD’S GOLD CURRENCY gleaming on the pallets, stacked to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I present you with a golden opportunity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DETONATOR’S TIMER counts down: 6:18,.6:17, 6:16...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were good at this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Shut up. If we pour the three gallon into the five gallon...

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: We did that.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, I’m onto something. Zeus quickly grabs the five gallon jug. He submerses it. It quickly fills with water. McClane, anxious, kneels next to hin.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: What I’m probably doing is gettin’ typhus and herpes from this shit. (he holds up the jug; it is full) The five gallon jug, filled to the top. Exactly five gallons, right?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Give me the three gallon. McClane hands Zeus the three gallon jug. Zeus pours the five gallon jug into the three gallon jug until the water comes to the brim. Zeus holds up the five gallon jug. It’s 2/5ths full.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: There were five gallons in here but I poured off EXACTLY three galions into that jug, leaving me EXACTLY two gallons in the five, correct?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: (concentrating) Yeah, right....  75.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Okay, watch. zeus empties the three gallon jug into the fountain. He picks up the five gallon jug and pours EXACTLY two gallons into the three gallon jug. During this, passing PEOPLE have begun to notice. McClane and Zeus get increasingly strange looks.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: EXACTLY two gallons in the three gallon, right? How much time? McClane looks at the timer.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Four minutes thirty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Shit. Okay...okay...we fill the five back up. ~- (submerses the five gallon jug) And then...uhh..... Zeus pauses.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Do the rest of it.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: I don’t know the rest of it.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: What? It was YOU who said: "don’t say anything unless you know." I THOUGHT YOU KNEW. (beat) Ooh . McClane grabs the handle of the three gallon jug (filled with EXACTLY two gallons), trying to YANK it from Zeus. Zeus holds on. They stand there, each with a handle. They pull back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Let go. I’m starting over. They both look down at -- THE SCALE’S DIGITAL TIMER: 4:00, 3:59, 3:58....

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: We can’t start over, McClane.  76. They stand there, each pulling on a jug handle. And now, out of the corner of his eye, McClane sees -- McClane’S POV - BY THE JUNGLE GYM - A 5 YEAR-OLD BOY is next to the SAMSONITE BRIEFCASE. He is picking it up by the handles. He smiles. Laughs. He’s cute. BACK TO SCENE - McClane’S EYES twitch with terror.

dialogues.speaker: MCLANE
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Zeus follows McClane’s eyes to the jungle gyn. “McClane screams at the little boy’s MOTHER:

dialogues.speaker: GET...GET AWAY FROM THAT.
dialogues.text: cuT TO: A PALLET OF GOLD BARS as THE BUCKET OF A SKID STEER rams into it and we widen to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon’s men are scooping up the huge pallets of gold bars. They move the gold like gravel, or rocks, with emphasis on speed. Bars are CLANGING on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skid steers, laden with gold bars, roll up to the dumptrucks and empty their loads. SIMON AND TARGO watch from the platforn. Simon looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SCALE’S TIMER reading: 00:31, 00:30, 00:29.... MCCLANE AND ZEUS are still trying to wrest the jug from each other. Both are furious, insistent:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, let go or I’1l kick your ass back to Harlem, you..... McClane catches himself. An icy pause.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Go ahead, say it. Nigger.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I wasn’t going to say that. Asshole, maybe. (looks at the timer) Twenty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: (looks at the jungle gym, panicking) Fuck this. Let’s get rid of the bomb. . But McClane isn’t listening:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I’ve got it. I’VE GOT IT!

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: What? You do? McClane holds up the three gallon jug.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Exactly two gallons, right? McClane sets the three gallon jug down. He pulls the five gallon jug out of the pond.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: And exactly five in here, right? So if we pour this into that until it comes to the top... McClane pours the full five gallon jug into the three gallon jug until the water brims at the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We‘re left with EXACTLY four gallons in the five gallon jug! Zeus looks on, thunderstruck.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: You did it. You did it! They stand there, triumphant. Then they remember -- THE DIGITAL TIMER, now reading: 00:05, 00:04, 00:03... McClane puts the five gallon on the scale -- e z McClane and Zeus sink to their knees, hyperventilating as -- THE PHONE next to the fountain RINGS. McClane goes to the phone. Grabs the receiver.  78.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Yeah. We did it. We HEAR HANDS CLAPPING over the phone receiver.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: And I thought you were stupid, John. (laughs) But then things are never what they seem, are they? CLOSE ON MCCLANE - as he listens to Simon laugh. McClane can’t articulate it yet, but he’s been here before. He has a feeling, a hunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon on the platforn. In the b.g. the dumptrucks are filled with gold bullion. Each truckbed is topped with a layer of dirt to cover the gold, then covered with a tarpaulin.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: A deal’s a deal, Simon. What school’s the bomb in?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Answer this and you will know: what is 27 out of 43? For the bomb’s disarming code, go to the New York public library and consult card catalogue number HXU-498. Simon clicks off his phone. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane hangs: up the phone. He pulls out a pen and records the card catalogue number.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: What’s twenty-seven out of forty- two? It’s a riddle. The answer’s where the bomb is. Come on. McClane walks off.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Twenty-seven out of forty-two? I have no idea. (follows McClane) Where’re you going?  79.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: New York Public Library. The bomb’s disarming code’s in one of the books.

dialogues.speaker: " ZEUS
dialogues.text: Hey. You forgetting something? McClane stops. Turns. Zeus is pointing across the park to the jungle gym, at the SAMSONITE BRIEFCASE with the bomb in it.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: I don’t think we should leave that there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane and Zeus exit Washington Square Park, McClane ww : ait. They head north on Fifth Avenue. Behind them they hear SHOUTING. They turn. . DOWN THE STREET - TWO KIDS, both about 12 or 13, come tearing out of a KOREAN DELICATESSEN a block away. They get on bikes and begin pedaling down the sidewalk. The proprietor, an irate KOREAN, exits the deli and chases.

dialogues.speaker: KOREAN PROPRIETOR
dialogues.text: Come back here! Thief! Little son of bitch! . The Korean Proprietor pulls up, panting. He curses and walks back to his store. The kids pedal across the intersection, laughing, laden with stolen candy, bags of chips, sodas, etc., heading straight for McClane and Zeus. As they pedal past -- McClane sticks his arm out, collaring KID 1. The bike CLATTERS on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Whoah, where ya going?

dialogues.speaker: KID 1
dialogues.text: (wrestling) Lemme go! The other kid pedals over to McClane. McClane let‘s go of Kid 1.. He falls on his can on the sidewalk. He glares up at McClane.

dialogues.speaker: KID 1
dialogues.text: You dickhead!

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Watch your mouth. Ever hear it’s against the law to steal?

dialogues.speaker: KID 2
dialogues.text: Not today it ain’t!

dialogues.speaker: KID 2
dialogues.text: Look around, man, there’s no cops in the city. TWO POLICE CRUISERS race past on Fifth Avenue, sirens BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: KID 1
dialogues.text: There’s a fire someplace or somethin’ goin’ on.

dialogues.speaker: KID 2
dialogues.text: It’s Christmas! Today you can steal anything you want! CLOSE ON MCCLANE - the wheels are spinning again. He’s been here before and now he comes to a decision. ~ McClane grabs Kid 2 by the collar and lifts him off the bike. He hands Zeus Kid 2’s bike. He picks up Kid 1’s bike off the sidewalk. Then, with the samsonite briefcase in hand, he pedals off down the sidewalk, heading south!

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: c’mon!

dialogues.speaker: KID 1
dialogues.text: (outraged) Hey! He’s stealing my bike! Zeus turns to the shocked Kids and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: It’s Christmas. You can steal anything you want. And Zeus pedals off after McClane, leaving -- THE KIDS on the sidewalk, staring slack-jawed. DOWN THE SIDEWALK - ZEUS pedals up to MCCLANE.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Where the hell you going?

dialogues.speaker: MCLANE
dialogues.text: Wall Street.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: What about the library?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: We’ll get there. I got a hunch. (off Zeus’ reaction) Work with me on this. McClane pedals on down the sidewalk. Zeus, scowling, pedals after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small street perpendicular to Wall Street. McClane and Zeus pedal down Christopher Street, stopping at the intersection of Christopher and Wall Street. Mcclane dismounts his bike. THE LAST OF SIMON’S DUMPTRUCKS is lumbering past McClane and Zeus, moving east. Zeus and McClane take no notice. McClane looks to his right -- MCCLANE’S POV - WALL STREET (LOOKING WEST) The Wall Street subway station is three blocks away. The TWO FAKE COPS (Simon’s men) are standing guard.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: looks around. His brow is furrowed, he is thinking a mile a minute, and he turns 180 degrees -- MCCLANE’S POV = PANNING 180 DEGREES FROM WALL STREET (LOOKING WEST) TO WALL STREET (LOOKING EAST)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NEW YORK FEDERAL RESERVE BUILDING looms up about three blocks east. A grand, marble-pillared building. BACK TO SCENE - MCCLANE’S EYES glint and now he thinks he’s onto something:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: (pointing at the Federal Reserve) See that building down there?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Here. . (hands Zeus the samsonite briefcase) Go get those two cops. Tell ‘em to meet me in the lobby.  82.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: McClane, would you tell me what the £....?

dialogues.speaker: " MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I don’t know’myself. Just do it, Zeus. Humor me for five minutes. McClane walks toward the Federal Reserve. Zeus frowns, exasperated, and walks toward the subway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeus pedals up to the station, stopping behind the barricade.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Hey. The two cops turn, see Zeus. They walk over.

dialogues.speaker: FAKE COP 1
dialogues.text: Yes, sir?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: I was told to come get you guys. The two fake cops look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: FAKE COP 2
dialogues.text: I’m sorry sir?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: A cop wants you to meet him in the lobby of that building down there. (points to the Federal Reserve) Don’t ask me. The two cops look at each other again. The tension is mounting.

dialogues.speaker: FAKE COP 2
dialogues.text: We can’t do that, sir. And strangely, they move outside the barricades and walk off down the street. Zeus watches them, perplexed. He looks around. He notices THE RAMPS leading into the crater. He dismounts the bike, sets down the samsonite briefcase, and steps past the barricades, heading toward the crater.
CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MCCLANE enters the lobby. Calm, uneventful, no customers. THREE FEDERAL MARSHALS stand guard: one behind the front desk; two at the METAL DETECTOR. They are SIMON’S MEN who commandeered the building. McClane steps up to the Guard (Nigel) behind the desk. He flips open his detective’s shield.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: McClane, N.Y.P.D. Nigel exchanges a tense glance with the other guards, then smiles at McClane, and says, in an American accent:

dialogues.speaker: DESK GUARD, (NIGEL)
dialogues.text: What can I do for you, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything strange happen - say in the last hour?

dialogues.speaker: DESK GUARD, (NIGEL)
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: You’re sure? The other guards apporach.

dialogues.speaker: DESK GUARD, (NIGEL)
dialogues.text: (to the other guards) You guys see anything funny the last hour?

dialogues.speaker: OTHER GUARDS, (FREDDY AND BERT)
dialogues.text: -- Nope. -- Not a thing.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Mind if I take a look at the vault? Take two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: DESK GUARD, (NIGEL)
dialogues.text: Be my guest. (rises, comes out from behind desk) This way. McClane follows the Guards across the lobby. They move past the metal detector and down the side corridor.
McClane continues toward THE STAIRWELL in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: DESK GUARD, (NIGEL)
dialogues.text: Lieutenant? McClane stops. He turns. The Desk Guard (Nigel) is pointing at the elevators.

dialogues.speaker: NIGEL
dialogues.text: (smiles) Take the lift. McClane begins to walk over to the elevator. CLOSE ON MCCLANE - Something isn’t kosher here. Something Nigel just said. McClane stops suddenly, turns, and begins looking around the corridor and lobby.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Hey, fellahs? I think I know what’s bothering me. As McClane walks away from the guards, he reaches inside his jacket and pulls his gun from his shoulder holster. THE GUARDS nervously look at each other. They didn’t want to kill McClane here but now they’1l have to.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: In America you never call....- THE GUARDS begin to pull their handguns and level them at McClane’s back, but -- MCCLANE spins, diving to the floor, his gun up and firing. In rapid succession McClane shoots and kills Nigel, Freddy and the other fake guard. McClane gets up and steps past their corpses.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: +-an elevator a "lift." McClane gets in the elevator and descends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeus walks down the ramp onto the subway platform. Simon’s abandoned SKID STEERS sit there. Zeus jumps onto the track and follows the line of abandoned equipment, toward the drilling hole. Bag  85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane comes down the corridor with extreme vigilance, training his gun left and right. He passes the monitoring room. The TWO FEDERAL MARSHALS are dead in their chairs. McClane comes to the vault. The door is open. The other Federal Marshals are unconscious on the ground. McClane moves vigilantly inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane enters. He looks at the DRILLED HOLE IN THE WALL. He HEARS something coming through the hole.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Don’t fuckin’ move! Zeus, emerges, throwing up his hands.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: It’s me! McClane, relieved, lowers his gun. Zeus moves into the vault. They look around stupified. All the gold is gone.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: (stunned) That motherfucking.... (beat) It was all a set-up.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: What was in here? McClane picks up a GOLD BAR at his feet. He hands it to Zeus. Zeus’ eyes widen, glinting in the reflection of the gleaming gold bar.

dialogues.speaker: _ MCCLANE
dialogues.text: About a hundred and thirty billion dollars of gold bullion.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: (nearly choking) ‘Scuse me, you say one billion...? (McClane nods) This whole room? Feel the weight o’ that - it’d take a tank to move that much. It‘d take...  86.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: ...dump trucks. It’d take about ten, big, industrial dumptrucks. They stare at each other, realizing that the last dumptruck was leaving when they arrived.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: It was heading east. McClane moves quickly to the vault door, saying to Zeus over his shoulder --

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Leave it, Zeus. Zeus frowns. He drops the gold bar and follows McClane. The gold bar THUDS on the floor. cUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane and Zeus run down the steps of the bank. MCCLANE runs to a PUBLIC PHONE on the corner. Punches numbers. The call connects and we hear: RECORDED VOICE (v.o.) You have reached the switchboard of the New York Police Department. At this moment, all our lines are.... cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THIRTY DISPATCHERS are blue in the face, handling ten times the normal volume. RECORDED VOICE (v.0.) ...busy. Please wait and your call will be handled.... Head dispatcher WANDA SHEPHERD is chainsmoking, watching her staff. She screams down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Sergeant, goddamn it, I need more lines! We got a twenty minute wait on some of these calls....! She lights another cigarette and -- cUT TO:  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MCCLANE anxiously tapping his fingers, waiting for the phone to connect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, is every fuckin’ cop in the city using this line....? DOWN THE STREET - ZEUS jogs along the curb, checking parked cars. He comes to a YUGO with it’s window half open. He reaches inside, unlocking the door.

dialogues.speaker: _ ZEUS
dialogues.text: McClane! McClane slams down the phone and runs over to Zeus. They get in, Zeus behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Police authority?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Be my guest. You know how to hot- wire? Zeus pulls a plastic folder from his pocket, opening it, revealing a small set of ELECTRICIAN’S SCREWDRIVERS.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: ‘Course I do, I’m an electrician. Only problem is... (he JAMS a screwdriver in the ignition; starts the car) ...it takes too fuckin’ long. Zeus throws it in a gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE YUGO pulls over by the subway blast site. The door opens. MCCLANE’S HAND reaches out and grabs the samsonite briefcase. The Yugo sputters off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bomb Squad Chief Charlie Weiss stands outside a public school in the Bronx. The entire block is baricaded off. A SUBORDINATE is briefing hin.

dialogues.speaker: SUBORDINATE
dialogues.text: They’re halfway done in Brooklyn. We're still behind schedule in Westchester County.  38. Wiess looks up as TWO BOMB SQUAD members come down the steps of the school, shaking their heads at Weiss. Weiss turns to his people.

dialogues.speaker: WEISS
dialogues.text: Franklin Elementary on Courtland Park Avenue. Let’s move it, people! Weiss and his men mobilize for the next school and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Yugo struggles up the ramp to the Brooklyn Bridge and stops. Zeus and McClane get out. Cars WHIZ past, HONKING. Zeus and McClane look around. From this vantage they can see: 1) to the east, the Brooklyn Bridge; 2) to the west, lower Manhattan, Wall Street, the Bowery; and 3).to the north, the F.D.R. Expressway stretching up the East River. ZEUS’ AND MCCLANE’S POV - SCANNING THE BROOKLYN BRIDGE There are no dumptrucks on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Nothing on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: 2EUS
dialogues.text: McClane. Zeus is pointing toward -- ZEUS’ AND MCCLANE’S POV - NORTH ON THE F.D.R. Lumbering up the F.D.R., about a mile north, is a line of TEN INDUSTRIAL DUMPTRUCKS.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: get in the Yugo and roar down the ramp onto the F.D.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERAL POLICE VANS are parked in the rotary island at Columbus Circle. A make-shift N.¥.P.D. Command Central. Chief Cobb sits in an open van, chewing gum. Joe Lambert and Ricky Walsh are reporting to hin.  8s.

dialogues.speaker: LAMBERT
dialogues.text: They're almost finished with the Bronx. We were worried about Brooklyn but the airport and Tri- boro cops covered our ass.

dialogues.speaker: WALSH
dialogues.text: The kids have been put in common areas: gymnasiums and cafeterias. Charlie’s guys are going school by school. So far they haven’t found shit.

dialogues.speaker: LAMBERT
dialogues.text: Any word from McClane?

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Nothing. (hopeful) Don’t worry. He’ll call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane is pounding his fist on the dash.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Where’s a goddamn phone?

dialogues.speaker: . ZEUS
dialogues.text: Carphone’s don’t exactly come standard in pieces of shit like this. You want me to pull over?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: And lose the trucks? Fuck that. UP AHEAD - THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD - The dumptrucks move slowly in the right lane, about 3/4ths of mile ahead.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: (looks at his watch) It’s 1:45. We got an hour fifteen. What about the library? We’ve gotta get that disarming code.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: What good’1l it do? We don’t know where the bomb js. What’s twenty- seven out of forty-two?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Don’t look at me. (thinks a moment; it dawns on him) Wait a minute. Clinton’s the forty second president.  90. They stare at each other, it dawning on then.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Presidents. That’s it. That’s gotta be it. You’re a fuckin’ genius. . (beat) So who was the twenty-seventh?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: You don’t?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: No. Do you?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: No. I got a "D" in history. (the engine SPUTTERS) This fuckin’ thing’s a go-cart.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: McClane. Zeus is pointing out his side window at -- A MERCEDES moving in traffic right next to them. At the wheel is a YUPPIE STOCKBROKER engrossed in conversation on a CELLULAR PHONE. McClane and Zeus exchange a knowing glance and we --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: THE MERCEDES’ TIRES SQUEALING away from the F.D.R. Expressway’s breakdown lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Yuppie stands there, open-mouthed, watching his Mercedes drive off. The YUGO is parked behind hin. Suddenly the Mercedes stops. The window rolls down. McClane sticks his head out. Screams at the Yuppie.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Hey! You know who the twenty- seventh president was?

dialogues.speaker: YUPPIE STOCKBROKER
dialogues.text: (nonplussed) No. The Mercedes SQUEALS off, fishtailing into traffic.  91. INT. MERCEDES’ ~- TRAVELING WITH MCCLANE AND ZEUS McClane is now driving. He grabs the cellular phone and punches buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is more like it. At this point they’re at about 60th street. The call connects. McClane listens to a RECORDING: RECORDED VOICE (v.0.) You have reached the switchboard of the New York Police Department. At this moment, all our lines are....

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Ahh FUCK, would you clear the goddamn switchboard....? McClane punches "redial" and waits. The Mercedes moves under an underpass. AHEAD, the expressway veers around a several corners. THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD - we can no longer see THE DUMPTRUCKS; they’ve gone around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: I can’t see ‘en.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry - they’re up there. RECORDED VOICE (v.0.) You have reached the switchboard of the New York Po.... (suddenly a human voice) Police dispatch, may I help you.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: It’s about fuckin’ time! This is Lieutenant John McClane, put me through to Chief Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB, on the phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT - COBB and MCCLANE

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Does this sound like a joke? They're right in front of me, Arthur. .

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Northbound on the F.D.R. About.... (looks at the passing streets) ...Seventy-fifth Street.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Seal off the bridges and tunnels.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: John, jesus christ, what about the bomb?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Arthur, just listen to me.... The line CRACKLES with static, then a DIAL TONE.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Ahh fuck me.... McClane punches "redial" again. The Mercedes is emerging from the underpass. zeus is looking ahead, through the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: McClane. THEIR POV - THROUGH WINDSHIELD - THE F.D.R. AHEAD - The dumptrucks are gone. They’ve vanished.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Where’d they go? McClane and Zeus look around frantically. The dumptrucks have seemingly vanished. Then:

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Down there! Zeus points and McClane looks -- THEIR POV - A SINGLE DUMPTRUCK is wheeling down a SIDE STREET off the F.D.R.  93. CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY ROLLINS, the N.Y.P.D. Captain of Traffic Police, is on the phone with Arthur Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HENRY ROLLINS
dialogues.text: Arthur, I don’t have the personnel to close a fuckin’ popsickle stand. You took ‘em already. (he settles) All right, all right. I can give you a hundred guys. Five to ten for every bridge and tunnel. cUuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB on the phone with Henry Rollins:

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: I love ya, Henry. Cobb hangs up and dials another number.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Janie, put me through to the F.B.I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClane and Zeus are panicking.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: When’s the next exit?

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: A hundred and tenth.

dialogues.speaker: _ MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I beg to differ. This thing have airbags? McClane SLAMS on the breaks and throws the wheel. The mercedes FISHTAILS into the left hand lane.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why? McClane? Ahh shiiittt....! McClane throws the wheel again. The Mercedes SMASHES through the guardrail and flies into the SOUTHBOUND LANE of the F.D.R.  94. ONCOMING CARS SCREECH, locking up their brakes as -- THE MERCEDES ROARS across the three southbound F.D.R. lanes, SMASHES through the far guardrail, and careens wildly onto 86TH STREET. MCCLANE throws the wheel, powersliding into a U-turn. He floors it and SPEEDS after the dumptruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mercedes closes on the DUMPTRUCK McClane and Zeus ~ saw from the F.D.R. The Mercedes overtakes the dumptruck, then SWERVES in front of it, SCREECHING TO A STOP, blocking it. The dumptruck stops. McClane and Zeus get out. McClane approaches the dumptruck, gun drawn, hollering:

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Get your hands up and get the fuck out! The terrified DRIVER throws up his hands. He gets out of the cab, quivering.

dialogues.speaker: DUMPTRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: Take it easy! McClane, still training the gun on the driver, backs up toward the bed of the dumptruck. He climbs onto the bumper and looks in the truckbed. THE TRUCKBED - is empty. McClane steps down from the bed, lowering the gun. He flips open his detective’s shield.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Where’re you going?

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: (points) Central Park - the aquaduct construction.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: (stunned) The New York City aquaduct? (points at the truck) Can you drive one o’ these through it?

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: That’s all I been doin’ the last five years. 95. McClane’s brain sparks ‘with understanding. It’s all clear to him now. He turns to Zeus.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Simon’s using the aquaduct to get off the island. (turns to the dumptruck driver) Can you follow the aquaduct above ground?

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Straight up the Saw Mill Parkway. Every quarter mile there’s a ventilation grate - can’t miss ‘en. McClane hand Zeus the slip of paper on which he recorded the card catalogue number.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: Go to the library and get the book, then follow the aguaduct north.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: I’m going in the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: ZEUS
dialogues.text: You know, you are one sick muthafucker, McClane.

dialogues.speaker: MCCLANE
dialogues.text: You know, Zeus, I think you’re . beginning to like me. (to the driver) Let’s go. McClane and the driver move quickly to the truck.

dialogues.speaker: . 2UES
dialogues.text: McClane, goddamn it.... But McClane is gone. Zeus scowls. He runs to the Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cuT TO: The point at which the aquaduct reaches Manhattan.  96. A LINE OF DUMPTRUCKS is entering the tunnel; ANOTHER LINE OF DUMPTRUCKS is exiting. PAANING PAST THE TRUCKS ENTERING THE TUNNEL - SIMON’S DUMPTRUCKS have fallen in line. We see MR. LUCK and SIMON’S OTHER DRIVERS behind the wheels of their trucks. INT. SIMON’S DUMPTRUCK SIMON, in the lead dumptruck, sits with Targo, who drives. Targo, grim as usual, looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: TARGO
dialogues.text: We're behind schedule.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: They know nothing, Mathius. And if they do, they’1l do exactly what we want - close the bridges and tunnels. (smiles) That can be made more difficult..... Simon, smiling, picks up his cellular phone as his ‘truck enters the aquaduct tunnel.
